c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the server SSL supported parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is MutualAuth.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket binding configuration that specifies the ORB port. The default value is iiop.

c:simple-property.name: ssl-socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket binding configuration that specifies the ORB SSL port. The default value is iiop-ssl.

c:simple-property.name: support-ssl
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether SSL is to be supported (on) or not (off). The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: transactions
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transactions interceptors are to be installed (on or spec) or not (off). The value 'on' enabled JTS while 'spec' enables a spec compliant mode (non JTS) that rejects incoming transaction contexts. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: trust-in-client
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if the transport must require trust in client to be established. Valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: trust-in-target
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if the transport must require trust in target to be established. Valid values are 'none' and 'supported'. The default value is none.

service.name: Remote Service (Profile)
service.description: The EJB3 remote service

c:simple-property.name: connector-ref
c:simple-property.description: The name of the connector on which the EJB3 remoting channel is registered

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the thread pool that handles remote invocations

service.name: Channel Creation Options (Profile)
service.description: The options that will be used during the EJB remote channel creation

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The type of the channel creation option

c:simple-property.name: value
c:simple-property.description: The value for the EJB remote channel creation option

service.name: Timer Service (Profile)
service.description: The EJB timer service

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: The directory to store persistent timer information in

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description: The relative path that is used to resolve the timer data store location

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the thread pool used to run timer service invocations

service.name: ThreadFactory (Profile)
service.description: A thread factory (implementing java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory).

c:simple-property.name: group-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the name of a thread group to create for this thread factory.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the created thread factory.

c:simple-property.name: priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: May be used to specify the thread priority of created threads. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: thread-name-pattern
c:simple-property.description: The template used to create names for threads. The following patterns may be used: %% - emit a percent sign %t - emit the per-factory thread sequence number %g - emit the global thread sequence number %f - emit the factory sequence number %i - emit the thread ID.

service.name: ThreadPool (Profile)
service.description: A thread pool executor

service.name: Security (Profile)
service.description: The configuration of the security subsystem.

c:simple-property.name: deep-copy-subject-mode
c:simple-property.description: Sets the copy mode of subjects done by the security managers to be deep copies that makes copies of the subject principals and credentials if they are cloneable. It should be set to true if subject include mutable content that can be corrupted when multiple threads have the same identity and cache flushes/logout clearing the subject in one thread results in subject references affecting other threads. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: cache-type
c:simple-property.description: Adds a cache to speed up authentication checks. Allowed values are 'default' to use simple map as the cache and 'infinispan' to use an Infinispan cache.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: cipher-suites
c:simple-property.description: Comma separated list of cipher suites to enable on SSLSockets.

c:simple-property.name: client-alias
c:simple-property.description: Preferred alias to use when the KeyManager chooses the client alias.

c:simple-property.name: client-auth
c:simple-property.description: Boolean attribute to indicate if client's certificates should also be authenticated on the server side.

c:simple-property.name: algorithm
c:simple-property.description: Algorithm to use when creating the KeyManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the KeyManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Sets the password of the keystore. Either this or 'truststore-password' must be present otherwise the security domain will be useless.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the keystore. If not set, type defaults to 'JKS'.

c:simple-property.name: url
c:simple-property.description: URL of the keystore.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the KeyStore.

c:simple-property.name: provider-argument
c:simple-property.description: String argument to pass to the keystore Provider constructor when instantiating it.

c:simple-property.name: protocols
c:simple-property.description: Comma separated list of protocols to enable on SSLSockets.

c:simple-property.name: server-alias
c:simple-property.description: Preferred alias to use when the KeyManager chooses the server alias.

c:simple-property.name: service-auth-token
c:simple-property.description: Token to retrieve PrivateKeys from the KeyStore.

c:simple-property.name: algorithm
c:simple-property.description: Algorithm to use when creating the TrustManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the TrustManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Sets the password of the truststore. Either this or 'keystore-password' must be present otherwise the security domain will be useless.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the truststore. If not set, type defaults to 'JKS'.

c:simple-property.name: url
c:simple-property.description: URL of the truststore.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the truststore.

c:simple-property.name: provider-argument
c:simple-property.description: String argument to pass to the truststore Provider constructor when instantiating it.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of mapping this module performs. Allowed values are principal, role, attribute or credential..

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of mapping this module performs. Allowed values are principal, role, attribute or credential..

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Fully Qualified Name of the Security Vault Implementation.

service.name: ActiveMQMessaging (Profile)
service.description: The messaging subsystems

service.name: ActiveMQ Artemis (Profile)
service.description: The ActiveMQ Artemis based messaging subsystem

c:simple-property.name: async-connection-execution-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether incoming packets on the server should be handed off to a thread from the thread pool for processing. False if they should be handled on the remoting thread. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-password
c:simple-property.description: The password used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is CHANGE ME!!.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-user
c:simple-property.description: The user used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is ACTIVEMQ.CLUSTER.ADMIN.USER.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl-override:expr
c:simple-property.description: If set, this will override how long (in ms) to keep a connection alive without receiving a ping. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: create-bindings-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the bindings directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: create-journal-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the journal directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: id-cache-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size of the cache for pre-creating message IDs. The default value is 20000.

c:list-property.name: incoming-interceptors
c:list-property.description: The list of incoming interceptor classes used by this server.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-domain
c:simple-property.description: The JMX domain used to register internal ActiveMQ MBeans in the MBeanServer. The default value is org.apache.activemq.artemis.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-management-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether ActiveMQ should expose its internal management API via JMX. This is not recommended, as accessing these MBeans can lead to inconsistent configuration. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size of the internal buffer on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout (in nanoseconds) used to flush internal buffers on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-min-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: The minimal number of journal data files before we can start compacting. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-percentage:expr
c:simple-property.description: The percentage of live data on which we consider compacting the journal. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: journal-file-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size (in bytes) of each journal file. The default value is 10485760.

c:simple-property.name: journal-max-io:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of write requests that can be in the AIO queue at any one time.

c:simple-property.name: journal-min-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: How many journal files to pre-create. The default value is 2.

c:simple-property.name: journal-pool-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of journal files that can be reused. ActiveMQ will create as many files as needed however when reclaiming files it will shrink back to the value (-1 means no limit). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-non-transactional
c:simple-property.description: Whether to wait for non transaction data to be synced to the journal before returning a response to the client. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-transactional
c:simple-property.description: Whether to wait for transaction data to be synchronized to the journal before returning a response to the client. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: journal-type
c:simple-property.description: The type of journal to use. The default value is ASYNCIO.

c:simple-property.name: log-journal-write-rate
c:simple-property.description: Whether to periodically log the journal's write rate and flush rate. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: management-address
c:simple-property.description: Address to send management messages to. The default value is jms.queue.activemq.management.

c:simple-property.name: management-notification-address
c:simple-property.description: The name of the address that consumers bind to to receive management notifications. The default value is activemq.notifications.

c:simple-property.name: memory-measure-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: Frequency to sample JVM memory in ms (or -1 to disable memory sampling). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: memory-warning-threshold:expr
c:simple-property.description: Percentage of available memory which if exceeded results in a warning log. The default value is 25.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-max-day-history:expr
c:simple-property.description: How many days to keep message counter history. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-sample-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: The sample period (in ms) to use for message counters. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: message-expiry-scan-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often (in ms) to scan for expired messages. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: message-expiry-thread-priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: The priority of the thread expiring messages. The default value is 3.

c:list-property.name: outgoing-interceptors
c:list-property.description: The list of outgoing interceptor classes used by this server.

c:simple-property.name: override-in-vm-security
c:simple-property.description: Whether the ActiveMQ server will override security credentials for in-vm connections. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: page-max-concurrent-io:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of concurrent reads allowed on paging. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: perf-blast-pages:expr
c:simple-property.description: TODO. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: persist-delivery-count-before-delivery
c:simple-property.description: Whether the delivery count is persisted before delivery. False means that this only happens after a message has been cancelled. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: persist-id-cache
c:simple-property.description: Whether IDs are persisted to the journal. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: persistence-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server will use the file based journal for persistence. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: run-sync-speed-test
c:simple-property.description: Whether on startup to perform a diagnostic test on how fast your disk can sync. Useful when determining performance issues. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: scheduled-thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of threads that the main scheduled thread pool has. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The security domain to use to verify user and role information. The default value is other.

c:simple-property.name: security-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether security is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: security-invalidation-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: How long (in ms) to wait before invalidating the security cache. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: server-dump-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often to dump basic runtime information to the server log. A value less than 1 disables this feature. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: statistics-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether gathering of statistics such as message counters are enabled. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of threads that the main thread pool has. -1 means no limit. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: How long (in ms) before a transaction can be removed from the resource manager after create time. The default value is 300000.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-timeout-scan-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often (in ms) to scan for timeout transactions. The default value is 1000.

c:simple-property.name: wild-card-routing-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server supports wild card routing. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: durable
c:simple-property.description: Whether the queue is durable or not. The default value is true.

c:list-property.name: entries
c:list-property.description: The jndi names the queue will be bound to.

c:simple-property.name: entry
c:simple-property.description: A single JNDI entry

c:simple-property.name: selector
c:simple-property.description: The queue selector.

c:list-property.name: entries
c:list-property.description: The jndi names the queue will be bound to.

c:simple-property.name: entry
c:simple-property.description: A single JNDI entry

c:simple-property.name: auto-group
c:simple-property.description: Whether or not message grouping is automatically used. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: block-on-acknowledge
c:simple-property.description: True to set block on acknowledge. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: block-on-durable-send
c:simple-property.description: True to set block on durable send. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: block-on-non-durable-send
c:simple-property.description: True to set block on non durable send. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: cache-large-message-client
c:simple-property.description: True to cache large messages. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: call-failover-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout to use when fail over is in process (in ms). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: call-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The call time out. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: client-failure-check-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: The client failure check period. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: client-id
c:simple-property.description: The client id.

c:simple-property.name: compress-large-messages
c:simple-property.description: Whether large messages should be compressed. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: confirmation-window-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation window size. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: connection-load-balancing-policy-class-name
c:simple-property.description: Name of a class implementing a client-side load balancing policy that a client can use to load balance sessions across different nodes in a cluster. The default value is org.apache.activemq.artemis.api.core.client.loadbalance.RoundRobinConnectionLoadBalancingPolicy.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl:expr
c:simple-property.description: The connection ttl. The default value is 60000.

c:list-property.name: connectors
c:list-property.description: Defines the connectors. These are stored in a map by connector name (with an undefined value). It is possible to pass a list of connector names when writing this attribute.

c:simple-property.name: consumer-max-rate:expr
c:simple-property.description: The consumer max rate. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: consumer-window-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The consumer window size. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: discovery-group
c:simple-property.description: The discovery group name.

c:simple-property.name: dups-ok-batch-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The dups ok batch size. The default value is 1048576.

c:list-property.name: entries
c:list-property.description: The jndi names the connection factory should be bound to.

c:simple-property.name: factory-type
c:simple-property.description: The type of connection factory. The default value is GENERIC.

c:simple-property.name: failover-on-initial-connection
c:simple-property.description: True to fail over on initial connection. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: group-id
c:simple-property.description: The group id.

c:simple-property.name: ha
c:simple-property.description: Whether the connection factory supports High Availability. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-retry-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: The max retry interval. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: min-large-message-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The min large message size. The default value is 102400.

c:simple-property.name: pre-acknowledge
c:simple-property.description: True to pre-acknowledge. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: producer-max-rate:expr
c:simple-property.description: The producer max rate. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: producer-window-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The producer window size. The default value is 65536.

c:simple-property.name: protocol-manager-factory
c:simple-property.description: The protocol manager factory used by this connection factory.

c:simple-property.name: reconnect-attempts:expr
c:simple-property.description: The reconnect attempts. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: The retry interval. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval-multiplier:expr
c:simple-property.description: The retry interval multiplier. The default value is 1.0.

c:simple-property.name: scheduled-thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The scheduled thread pool max size. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The thread pool max size. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-batch-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The transaction batch size. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: use-global-pools
c:simple-property.description: True to use global pools. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: auto-group
c:simple-property.description: Whether or not message grouping is automatically used. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: block-on-acknowledge
c:simple-property.description: True to set block on acknowledge. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: block-on-durable-send
c:simple-property.description: True to set block on durable send. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: block-on-non-durable-send
c:simple-property.description: True to set block on non durable send. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: cache-large-message-client
c:simple-property.description: True to cache large messages. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: call-failover-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout to use when fail over is in process (in ms). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: call-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The call time out. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: client-failure-check-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: The client failure check period. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: client-id
c:simple-property.description: The client id.

c:simple-property.name: compress-large-messages
c:simple-property.description: Whether large messages should be compressed. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: confirmation-window-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation window size. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: connection-load-balancing-policy-class-name
c:simple-property.description: Name of a class implementing a client-side load balancing policy that a client can use to load balance sessions across different nodes in a cluster. The default value is org.apache.activemq.artemis.api.core.client.loadbalance.RoundRobinConnectionLoadBalancingPolicy.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl:expr
c:simple-property.description: The connection ttl. The default value is 60000.

c:list-property.name: connectors
c:list-property.description: Defines the connectors. These are stored in a map by connector name (with an undefined value). It is possible to pass a list of connector names when writing this attribute.

c:simple-property.name: consumer-max-rate:expr
c:simple-property.description: The consumer max rate. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: consumer-window-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The consumer window size. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: discovery-group
c:simple-property.description: The discovery group name.

c:simple-property.name: dups-ok-batch-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The dups ok batch size. The default value is 1048576.

c:list-property.name: entries
c:list-property.description: The jndi names the connection factory should be bound to.

c:simple-property.name: factory-type
c:simple-property.description: The type of connection factory. The default value is GENERIC.

c:simple-property.name: failover-on-initial-connection
c:simple-property.description: True to fail over on initial connection. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: group-id
c:simple-property.description: The group id.

c:simple-property.name: ha
c:simple-property.description: Whether the connection factory supports High Availability. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-retry-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: The max retry interval. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: min-large-message-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The min large message size. The default value is 102400.

c:simple-property.name: pre-acknowledge
c:simple-property.description: True to pre-acknowledge. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: producer-max-rate:expr
c:simple-property.description: The producer max rate. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: producer-window-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The producer window size. The default value is 65536.

c:simple-property.name: protocol-manager-factory
c:simple-property.description: The protocol manager factory used by this connection factory.

c:simple-property.name: reconnect-attempts:expr
c:simple-property.description: The reconnect attempts. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: The retry interval. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval-multiplier:expr
c:simple-property.description: The retry interval multiplier. The default value is 1.0.

c:simple-property.name: scheduled-thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The scheduled thread pool max size. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The thread pool max size. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-batch-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The transaction batch size. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: use-global-pools
c:simple-property.description: True to use global pools. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: consume
c:simple-property.description: his permission allows the user to consume a message from a queue bound to matching addresses. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: create-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to create a durable queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: create-non-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to create a temporary queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: delete-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to delete a durable queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: delete-non-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to delete a temporary queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: manage
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to invoke management operations by sending management messages to the management address. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: send
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to send a message to matching addresses. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: address-full-policy
c:simple-property.description: Determines what happens when an address where max-size-bytes is specified becomes full. (PAGE, DROP or BLOCK). The default value is PAGE.

c:simple-property.name: dead-letter-address
c:simple-property.description: The dead letter address

c:simple-property.name: expiry-address
c:simple-property.description: Defines where to send a message that has expired.

c:simple-property.name: last-value-queue
c:simple-property.description: Defines whether a queue only uses last values or not. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-delivery-attempts
c:simple-property.description: Defines how many time a cancelled message can be redelivered before sending to the dead-letter-address. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: max-size-bytes
c:simple-property.description: The max bytes size. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-history-day-limit
c:simple-property.description: Day limit for the message counter history. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: page-max-cache-size
c:simple-property.description: The number of page files to keep in memory to optimize IO during paging navigation. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: page-size-bytes
c:simple-property.description: The paging size. The default value is 10485760.

c:simple-property.name: redelivery-delay
c:simple-property.description: Defines how long to wait before attempting redelivery of a cancelled message. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: redistribution-delay
c:simple-property.description: Defines how long to wait when the last consumer is closed on a queue before redistributing any messages. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: send-to-dla-on-no-route
c:simple-property.description: If this parameter is set to true for that address, if the message is not routed to any queues it will instead be sent to the dead letter address (DLA) for that address, if it exists. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: grouping-handler-address
c:simple-property.description: A reference to a cluster connection and the address it uses.

c:simple-property.name: timeout
c:simple-property.description: How long to wait for a handling decision to be made; an exception will be thrown during the send if this timeout is reached, ensuring that strict ordering is kept. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Whether the handler is the single 'Local' handler for the cluster, which makes handling decisions, or a 'Remote' handler which converses with the local handler.

c:simple-property.name: factory-class
c:simple-property.description: The factory class.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The socket binding reference.

c:simple-property.name: factory-class
c:simple-property.description: The factory class.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The socket binding reference.

c:simple-property.name: server-id
c:simple-property.description: The server id.

c:simple-property.name: server-id
c:simple-property.description: The server id.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The socket binding reference.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The socket binding reference.

c:simple-property.name: divert-address
c:simple-property.description: Address to divert from

c:simple-property.name: exclusive
c:simple-property.description: Whether the divert is exclusive, meaning that the message is diverted to the new address, and does not go to the old address at all. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: filter
c:simple-property.description: An optional filter string. If specified then only messages which match the filter expression specified will be diverted. The filter string follows the ActiveMQ Artemis filter expression syntax described in the ActiveMQ Artemis documentation.

c:simple-property.name: forwarding-address
c:simple-property.description: Address to divert to

c:simple-property.name: routing-name
c:simple-property.description: Routing name of the divert

c:simple-property.name: transformer-class-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of a class used to transform the message's body or properties before it is diverted.

service.name: Module Option
service.description: The module options to be used.

c:list-property.name: Modules Options
c:list-property.description: List of module options.

c:simple-property.name: durable
c:simple-property.description: Defines whether the queue is durable. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: filter
c:simple-property.description: A queue message filter definition. An undefined or empty filter will match all messages.

c:simple-property.name: queue-address
c:simple-property.description: The queue address defines what address is used for routing messages.

service.name: Core Address (Profile)
service.description: A runtime-only resource representing a ActiveMQ Artemis address. Zero or more queues can be bound to a single address. When a message is routed, it is routed to the set of queues bound to the message's address.

c:list-property.name: binding-names
c:list-property.description: The names of all bindings (both queues and diverts) bound to this address.

c:simple-property.name: number-of-bytes-per-page
c:simple-property.description: The number of bytes used by each page for this address.

c:simple-property.name: number-of-pages
c:simple-property.description: The number of pages used by this address.

c:list-property.name: queue-names
c:list-property.description: The names of the queues associated with the address.

c:list-property.name: roles
c:list-property.description: A list of the security roles (name and permissions) associated with the address.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of a security role.

c:simple-property.name: send
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to send a message to matching addresses.

c:simple-property.name: consume
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to consume a message from a queue bound to matching addresses.

c:simple-property.name: create-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to create a durable queue.

c:simple-property.name: delete-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to delete a durable queue.

c:simple-property.name: manage
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to invoke management operations by sending management messages to the management address.

c:simple-property.name: create-non-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to create a temporary queue.

c:simple-property.name: delete-non-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to delete a temporary queue.

c:simple-property.name: call-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The timeout (in ms) for remote calls made by the cluster connection. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: check-period
c:simple-property.description: The period (in milliseconds) between client failure check. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-connection-address
c:simple-property.description: Each cluster connection only applies to messages sent to an address that starts with this value.

c:simple-property.name: confirmation-window-size
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation-window-size to use for the connection used to forward messages to a target node. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl
c:simple-property.description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) for which the connections used by the cluster connections are considered alive (in the absence of heartbeat). The default value is 60000.

c:simple-property.name: connector-ref
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation-window-size to use for the connection used to forward messages to a target node.

c:simple-property.name: discovery-group-name
c:simple-property.description: The discovery group used to obtain the list of other servers in the cluster to which this cluster connection will make connections. Must be undefined (null) if 'static-connectors' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: forward-when-no-consumers
c:simple-property.description: Whether messages will be distributed round robin between other nodes of the cluster irrespective of whether there are matching or indeed any consumers on other nodes. If this is set to false (the default) then ActiveMQ Artemis will only forward messages to other nodes of the cluster if the address to which they are being forwarded has queues which have consumers, and if those consumers have message filters (selectors) at least one of those selectors must match the message. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-hops
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of times a message can be forwarded. ActiveMQ Artemis can be configured to also load balance messages to nodes which might be connected to it only indirectly with other ActiveMQ Artemis servers as intermediates in a chain. The default value is 1.

c:simple-property.name: max-retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The maximum interval of time used to retry connections. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: min-large-message-size
c:simple-property.description: The minimum size (in bytes) for a message before it is considered as a large message. The default value is 102400.

c:simple-property.name: reconnect-attempts
c:simple-property.description: The total number of reconnect attempts the bridge will make before giving up and shutting down. A value of -1 signifies an unlimited number of attempts. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The period in milliseconds between subsequent reconnection attempts, if the connection to the target server has failed. The default value is 500.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval-multiplier
c:simple-property.description: A multiplier to apply to the time since the last retry to compute the time to the next retry. This allows you to implement an exponential backoff between retry attempts. The default value is 1.0.

c:list-property.name: static-connectors:nullable
c:list-property.description: The statically defined list of connectors to which this cluster connection will make connections. Must be undefined (null) if 'discovery-group-name' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: use-duplicate-detection
c:simple-property.description: Whether the bridge will automatically insert a duplicate id property into each message that it forwards. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: broadcast-period
c:simple-property.description: The period in milliseconds between consecutive broadcasts. The default value is 2000.

c:list-property.name: connectors
c:list-property.description: Specifies the names of connectors that will be broadcast.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The broadcast group socket binding.

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description:
The actual filesystem path. Treated as an absolute path, unless the 'relative-to' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.

If treated as an absolute path, the actual runtime pathname specified by the value of this attribute will be determined as follows:

If this value is already absolute, then the value is directly used. Otherwise the runtime pathname is resolved in a system-dependent way. On UNIX systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current user directory. On Microsoft Windows systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current directory of the drive named by the pathname, if any; if not, it is resolved against the current user directory.

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description:
The name of another previously named path, or of one of the standard paths provided by the system. If 'relative-to' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute. The standard paths provided by the system include:
  • jboss.home - the root directory of the JBoss AS distribution
  • user.home - user's home directory
  • user.dir - user's current working directory
  • java.home - java installation directory
  • jboss.server.base.dir - root directory for an individual server instance
  • jboss.server.data.dir - directory the server will use for persistent data file storage
  • jboss.server.log.dir - directory the server will use for log file storage
  • jboss.server.tmp.dir - directory the server will use for temporary file storage
  • jboss.domain.servers.dir - directory under which a host controller will create the working area for individual server instances

c:simple-property.name: __name
c:simple-property.description: Path Type

c:template.name: Journal Directory
c:template.description: The directory in which the message journal lives. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/journal.

c:template.name: Paging Directory
c:template.description: The directory where page files are stored. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/paging.

c:template.name: Large Messages Directory
c:template.description: The directory in which large messages are stored. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/largemessages.

c:template.name: Bindings Directory
c:template.description: The directory in which the bindings journal lives. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/bindings.

c:simple-property.name: check-period
c:simple-property.description: The period (in milliseconds) between client failure check. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: confirmation-window-size
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation-window-size to use for the connection used to forward messages to the target node. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl
c:simple-property.description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) for which the connections used by the bridges are considered alive (in the absence of heartbeat). The default value is 60000.

c:simple-property.name: discovery-group-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the discovery group used by this bridge. Must be undefined (null) if 'static-connectors' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: failover-on-server-shutdown
c:simple-property.description: Whether the bridge will attempt to failover onto a backup server (if specified) when the target server is cleanly shutdown rather than crashed.

c:simple-property.name: filter
c:simple-property.description: An optional filter string. If specified then only messages which match the filter expression specified will be forwarded. The filter string follows the ActiveMQ Artemis filter expression syntax described in the ActiveMQ Artemis documentation.

c:simple-property.name: forwarding-address
c:simple-property.description: The address on the target server that the message will be forwarded to. If a forwarding address is not specified then the original destination of the message will be retained.

c:simple-property.name: ha
c:simple-property.description: Whether or not this bridge should support high availability. True means it will connect to any available server in a cluster and support failover. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The maximum interval of time used to retry connections. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: min-large-message-size
c:simple-property.description: The minimum size (in bytes) for a message before it is considered as a large message. The default value is 102400.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: The password to use when creating the bridge connection to the remote server. If it is not specified the default cluster password specified by the cluster-password attribute in the root messaging subsystem resource will be used. The default value is CHANGE ME!!.

c:simple-property.name: queue-name
c:simple-property.description: The unique name of the local queue that the bridge consumes from.

c:simple-property.name: reconnect-attempts
c:simple-property.description: The total number of reconnect attempts the bridge will make before giving up and shutting down. A value of -1 signifies an unlimited number of attempts. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The period in milliseconds between subsequent reconnection attempts, if the connection to the target server has failed. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval-multiplier
c:simple-property.description: A multiplier to apply to the time since the last retry to compute the time to the next retry. This allows you to implement an exponential backoff between retry attempts. The default value is 1.0.

c:list-property.name: static-connectors:nullable
c:list-property.description: A list of names of statically defined connectors used by this bridge. Must be undefined (null) if 'discovery-group-name' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: transformer-class-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of a user-defined class which implements the org.apache.activemq.artemis.core.server.cluster.Transformer interface.

c:simple-property.name: use-duplicate-detection
c:simple-property.description: Whether the bridge will automatically insert a duplicate id property into each message that it forwards. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: user
c:simple-property.description: The user name to use when creating the bridge connection to the remote server. If it is not specified the default cluster user specified by the cluster-user attribute in the root messaging subsystem resource will be used. The default value is ACTIVEMQ.CLUSTER.ADMIN.USER.

c:simple-property.name: initial-wait-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Period, in ms, to wait for an initial broadcast to give us at least one node in the cluster. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: refresh-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Period the discovery group waits after receiving the last broadcast from a particular server before removing that server's connector pair entry from its list. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The discovery group socket binding.

c:simple-property.name: factory-class
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the factory class that can instantiate the connector service.

service.name: JVM
service.description: Information about the underlying JVM

metric.description: The number of processors available to the Java virtual machine.
The system load average for the last minute. The load average may not be available on some platforms; if the load average is not available, a negative value is returned.

operation.name: gc
operation.description: Runs the garbage collector.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Runs the garbage collector.

metric.description: The approximate number of objects for which finalization is pending.
The amount of memory in bytes that the Java virtual machine initially requests from the operating system for memory management.
The amount of used memory in bytes.
The amount of memory in bytes that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use.
The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management.
The amount of memory in bytes that the Java virtual machine initially requests from the operating system for memory management.
The amount of used memory in bytes.
The amount of memory in bytes that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use.
The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management.
The uptime of the Java virtual machine in milliseconds.

operation.name: dump-all-threads
operation.description: Returns the thread info for all live threads with stack trace and synchronization information.

c:simple-property.name: locked-monitors
c:simple-property.description: Whether the result should include information on locked monitors.

c:simple-property.name: locked-synchronizers
c:simple-property.description: Whether the result should include information on locked ownable synchronizers.

operation.name: find-deadlocked-threads
operation.description: Finds cycles of threads that are in deadlock waiting to acquire object monitors or ownable synchronizers.

operation.name: find-monitor-deadlocked-threads
operation.description: Finds cycles of threads that are in deadlock waiting to acquire object monitors.

operation.name: get-thread-cpu-time
operation.description: Returns the total CPU time for a thread of the specified ID in nanoseconds.

c:simple-property.name: id
c:simple-property.description: The thread ID of the thread. Must be positive.

operation.name: get-thread-info
operation.description: Returns the thread info for a thread of the specified id. The stack trace, locked monitors, and locked synchronizers in the returned reply object will be empty.

c:simple-property.name: id
c:simple-property.description: The thread ID of the thread. Must be positive.

c:simple-property.name: max-depth
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of entries in the stack trace to be dumped. Integer.MAX_VALUE could be used to request the entire stack to be dumped. The default value is 0.

operation.name: get-thread-infos
operation.description: Returns the thread info for each thread whose ID is in the input list.

c:list-property.name: ids
c:list-property.description: A list of thread ids.

c:simple-property.name: max-depth
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of entries in the stack trace to be dumped. Integer.MAX_VALUE could be used to request the entire stack to be dumped. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: locked-monitors
c:simple-property.description: Whether the result should include information on locked monitors. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: locked-synchronizers
c:simple-property.description: Whether the result should include information on locked monitors. The default value is false.

operation.name: get-thread-user-time
operation.description: Returns the CPU time that a thread of the specified ID has executed in user mode in nanoseconds.

c:simple-property.name: id
c:simple-property.description: The thread ID of the thread. Must be positive.

operation.name: reset-peak-thread-count
operation.description: Resets the peak thread count to the current number of live threads.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Resets the peak thread count to the current number of live threads.

operation.name: get-all-thread-ids
operation.description: Get all live thread IDs. If a security manager is installed and the caller does not have ManagementPermission('monitor'), the result will be undefined.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: List of thread ids

metric.description: The current number of live threads including both daemon and non-daemon threads.
The peak live thread count since the Java virtual machine started or peak was reset.
The total number of threads created and also started since the Java virtual machine started.
The current number of live daemon threads.

The total CPU time for the current thread in nanoseconds, or -1 if 'thread-cpu-time-enabled' is 'false'. A Java virtual machine implementation may not support CPU time measurement. If 'thread-cpu-time-supported', is 'false' undefined.

The CPU time that the current thread has executed in user mode in nanoseconds, or -1 if 'thread-cpu-time-enabled' is 'false'. A Java virtual machine implementation may not support CPU time measurement. If 'thread-cpu-time-supported', is 'false' the result will be undefined

c:simple-property.name: thread-contention-monitoring-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether thread contention monitoring is enabled.

c:simple-property.name: thread-cpu-time-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether thread CPU time measurement is enabled.

c:simple-property.name: thread-contention-monitoring-supported
c:simple-property.description: Whether the Java virtual machine supports thread contention monitoring.

c:simple-property.name: thread-cpu-time-supported
c:simple-property.description: Whether the Java virtual machine implementation supports CPU time measurement for any thread.

c:simple-property.name: current-thread-cpu-time-supported
c:simple-property.description: Whether the Java virtual machine supports CPU time measurement for the current thread.

c:simple-property.name: object-monitor-usage-supported
c:simple-property.description: Whether the Java virtual machine supports monitoring of object monitor usage.

c:simple-property.name: synchronizer-usage-supported
c:simple-property.description: Whether the Java virtual machine supports monitoring of ownable synchronizer usage.

service.name: Garbage Collector
service.description: Parent resource for the resources providing the management interface for the garbage collection of the Java virtual machine.

service.name: Garbage Collector Resource
service.description: The management interface for one of the garbage collectors in the Java virtual machine.

metric.description: The total number of collections that have occurred.
The approximate accumulated collection elapsed time in milliseconds.
The name representing this garbage collector
Whether this this memory manager is valid in the Java virtual machine.

c:list-property.name: memory-pool-names
c:list-property.description: The name of memory pools that this garbage collector manages.

service.name: Memory Pool
service.description: Parent resource for the resources providing the management interface for the Java virtual machine's memory pools.

service.name: Memory Pool Resource
service.description: The management interface for a memory pool. A memory pool represents the memory resource managed by the Java virtual machine and is managed by one or more memory managers.

operation.name: subsystem:reset-peak-usage
operation.description: Resets the peak memory usage statistic of this memory pool to the current memory usage.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Resets the peak memory usage statistic of this memory pool to the current memory usage.

metric.description: The amount of memory in bytes that the Java virtual machine initially requests from the operating system for memory management.
The amount of used memory in bytes.
The amount of memory in bytes that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use.
The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management.

The number of times that the Java virtual machine has detected that the memory usage has reached or exceeded the collection usage threshold. A memory pool may not support a collection usage threshold. If 'collection-usage-threshold-supported', is 'false' trying to read this attribute via the 'read-attribute' operation will result in failure, and the value of this attribute in the result of a 'read-resource' operation will be 'undefined'.

Whether the memory usage of this memory pool after the most recent collection on which the Java virtual machine has expended effort has reached or exceeded its collection usage threshold. A memory pool may not support a collection usage threshold. If 'collection-usage-threshold-supported', is 'false' trying to read this attribute via the 'read-attribute' operation will result in failure, and the value of this attribute in the result of a 'read-resource' operation will be 'undefined'.
Whether this memory pool supports a collection usage threshold.
The name representing this memory pool.
The amount of memory in bytes that the Java virtual machine initially requests from the operating system for memory management.
The amount of used memory in bytes.
The amount of memory in bytes that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use.
The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management.
The type of this memory pool.
The amount of memory in bytes that the Java virtual machine initially requests from the operating system for memory management.
The amount of used memory in bytes.
The amount of memory in bytes that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use.
The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management.

The number of times that the memory usage has crossed the usage threshold. A memory pool may not support a usage threshold. If 'usage-threshold-supported', is 'false' trying to read this attribute via the 'read-attribute' operation will result in failure, and the value of this attribute in the result of a 'read-resource' operation will be 'undefined'.

Whether the memory usage of this memory pool reaches or exceeds its usage threshold value. A memory pool may not support a usage threshold. If 'usage-threshold-supported', is 'false' trying to read this attribute via the 'read-attribute' operation will result in failure, and the value of this attribute in the result of a 'read-resource' operation will be 'undefined'.
Whether this memory pool supports usage threshold.
Whether this memory pool is valid in the Java virtual machine. A memory pool becomes invalid once the Java virtual machine removes it from the memory system.

c:simple-property.name: collection-usage-threshold
c:simple-property.description: The collection usage threshold value of this memory pool in bytes. A memory pool may not support a collection usage threshold. If 'collection-usage-threshold-supported', is 'false' trying to read this attribute via the 'read-attribute' operation will result in failure, and the value of this attribute in the result of a 'read-resource' operation will be 'undefined'.

c:list-property.name: memory-manager-names
c:list-property.description: The names of the memory managers that manage this memory pool.

c:simple-property.name: usage-threshold
c:simple-property.description: The usage threshold value of this memory pool in bytes. A memory pool may not support a usage threshold. If 'usage-threshold-supported', is 'false' trying to read this attribute via the 'read-attribute' operation will result in failure, and the value of this attribute in the result of a 'read-resource' operation will be 'undefined'.

c:simple-property.name: default-security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The default security domain used by web deployments. The default value is other.

c:simple-property.name: default-server
c:simple-property.description: The default server to use for deployments. The default value is default-server.

c:simple-property.name: default-servlet-container
c:simple-property.description: The default servlet container to use for deployments. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: default-virtual-host
c:simple-property.description: The default virtual host to use for deployments. The default value is default-host.

c:simple-property.name: instance-id
c:simple-property.description: The cluster instance id. The default value is {EXPRESSION_VALUE=${jboss.node.name}}.

c:simple-property.name: statistics-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Configures if are statistics enabled. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: code:expr
c:simple-property.description: Error page code

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: Error page path

c:simple-property.name: expression
c:simple-property.description: The expression that defines the filter

c:simple-property.name: module
c:simple-property.description: Module to use to load the filter definitions

c:simple-property.name: advertise-frequency:expr
c:simple-property.description: The frequency (in milliseconds) that mod-cluster advertises itself on the network. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: advertise-path
c:simple-property.description: The path that mod-cluster is registered under, defaults to /. The default value is /.

c:simple-property.name: advertise-protocol
c:simple-property.description: The protocol that is in use, defaults to HTTP. The default value is http.

c:simple-property.name: advertise-socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The multicast group that is used to advertise

c:simple-property.name: broken-node-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The amount of time that must elapse before a broken node is removed from the table. The default value is 60000.

c:simple-property.name: cached-connections-per-thread:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of connections that will be kept alive indefinitely. The default value is 40.

c:simple-property.name: connection-idle-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The amount of time a connection can be idle before it will be closed. Connections will not time out once the pool size is down to the configured minimum (as configured by cached-connections-per-thread). The default value is 60.

c:simple-property.name: connections-per-thread:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of connections that will be maintained to backend servers, per IO thread. Defaults to 10. The default value is 40.

c:simple-property.name: enable-http2
c:simple-property.description: If the load balancer should attempt to upgrade back end connections to HTTP2. If HTTP2 is not supported HTTP or HTTPS will be used as normal. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: health-check-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: The frequency of health check pings to backend nodes. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: management-access-predicate
c:simple-property.description: A predicate that is applied to incoming requests to determine if they can perform mod cluster management commands. Provides additional security on top of what is provided by limiting management to requests that originate from the management-socket-binding

c:simple-property.name: management-socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The socket binding of the mod_cluster management port. When using mod_cluster two HTTP listeners should be defined, a public one to handle requests, and one bound to the internal network to handle mod cluster commands. This socket binding should correspond to the internal listener, and should not be publicly accessible

c:simple-property.name: max-ajp-packet-size
c:simple-property.description: The maximum size for AJP packets. Increasing this will allow AJP to work for requests/responses that have a large amount of headers. This is an advanced option, and must be the same between load balancers and backend servers.

c:simple-property.name: max-request-time:expr
c:simple-property.description: The max amount of time that a request to a backend node can take before it is killed. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: request-queue-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of requests that can be queued if the connection pool is full before requests are rejected with a 503. The default value is 1000.

c:simple-property.name: security-key
c:simple-property.description: The security key that is used for the mod-cluster group. All members must use the same security key.

c:simple-property.name: security-realm
c:simple-property.description: The security realm that provides the SSL configuration

c:simple-property.name: use-alias
c:simple-property.description: If an alias check is performed. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: worker
c:simple-property.description: The XNIO worker that is used to send the advertise notifications. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: redirect
c:simple-property.description: If this is true then a redirect will be done instead of a rewrite. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: target
c:simple-property.description: The expression that defines the target. If you are redirecting to a constant target put single quotes around the value

c:simple-property.name: header-name
c:simple-property.description: Header name

c:simple-property.name: header-value
c:simple-property.description: Value for header

c:simple-property.name: max-concurrent-requests:expr
c:simple-property.description: Maximum number of concurrent requests

c:simple-property.name: queue-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: Number of requests to queue before they start being rejected

c:simple-property.name: class-name
c:simple-property.description: Class name of HttpHandler

c:simple-property.name: module
c:simple-property.description: Module name where class can be loaded from

c:simple-property.name: cache-buffer-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: Size of the buffers. The default value is 1024.

c:simple-property.name: cache-buffers:expr
c:simple-property.description: Number of buffers. The default value is 1024.

c:simple-property.name: case-sensitive
c:simple-property.description: Use case sensitive file handling. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: directory-listing
c:simple-property.description: Enable directory listing?. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: follow-symlink
c:simple-property.description: Enable following symbolic links. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: Path on filesystem from where file handler will serve resources

c:list-property.name: safe-symlink-paths
c:list-property.description: Paths that are safe to be targets of symbolic links

c:simple-property.name: cached-connections-per-thread:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of connections that will be kept alive indefinitely. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: connection-idle-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The amount of time a connection can be idle before it will be closed. Connections will not time out once the pool size is down to the configured minimum (as configured by cached-connections-per-thread). The default value is 60.

c:simple-property.name: connections-per-thread:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of connections that will be maintained to backend servers, per IO thread. Defaults to 10. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: max-request-time:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum time that a proxy request can be active for, before being killed. Defaults to unlimited. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: problem-server-retry:expr
c:simple-property.description: Time in seconds to wait before attempting to reconnect to a server that is down. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: request-queue-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of requests that can be queued if the connection pool is full before requests are rejected with a 503. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: session-cookie-names
c:simple-property.description: Comma separated list of session cookie names. Generally this will just be JSESSIONID. The default value is JSESSIONID.

c:simple-property.name: instance-id
c:simple-property.description: The instance id (aka JVM route) that will be used to enable sticky sessions

c:simple-property.name: outbound-socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: Outbound socket binding for this host

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: Optional path if host is using non root resource. The default value is /.

c:simple-property.name: scheme
c:simple-property.description: What kind of scheme is used. The default value is http.

c:simple-property.name: security-realm
c:simple-property.description: The security realm that provides the SSL configuration for the connection to the host

c:simple-property.name: buffer-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size of an individual buffer. The default value is 1024.

c:simple-property.name: buffers-per-region:expr
c:simple-property.description: The numbers of buffers in a region. The default value is 1024.

c:simple-property.name: max-regions:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of regions. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: default-host
c:simple-property.description: The servers default virtual host. The default value is default-host.

c:simple-property.name: servlet-container
c:simple-property.description: The servers default servlet container. The default value is default.

metric.description: The number of bytes that have been received by this listener
The number of bytes that have been sent out on this listener
The number of 500 responses that have been sent by this listener
The maximum processing time taken by a request on this listener
The total processing time of all requests handed by this listener
The number of requests this listener has served

c:simple-property.name: allow-encoded-slash
c:simple-property.description: If a request comes in with encoded / characters (i.e. %2F), will these be decoded. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: allow-equals-in-cookie-value
c:simple-property.description: If this is true then Undertow will allow non-escaped equals characters in unquoted cookie values. Unquoted cookie values may not contain equals characters. If present the value ends before the equals sign. The remainder of the cookie value will be dropped. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: always-set-keep-alive
c:simple-property.description: If this is true then a Connection: keep-alive header will be added to responses, even when it is not strictly required by the specification. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: buffer-pipelined-data
c:simple-property.description: If we should buffer pipelined requests. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: buffer-pool
c:simple-property.description: The AJP listeners buffer pool. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: decode-url
c:simple-property.description: If this is true then the parser will decode the URL and query parameters using the selected character encoding (UTF-8 by default). If this is false they will not be decoded. This will allow a later handler to decode them into whatever charset is desired. The default value is true.

c:list-property.name: disallowed-methods
c:list-property.description: A comma separated list of HTTP methods that are not allowed

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: If the listener is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: max-buffered-request-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: Maximum size of a buffered request, in bytesRequests are not usually buffered, the most common case is when performing SSL renegotiation for a POST request, and the post data must be fullybuffered in order to perform the renegotiation. The default value is 16384.

c:simple-property.name: max-connections:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of concurrent connections.

c:simple-property.name: max-cookies:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of cookies that will be parsed. This is used to protect against hash vulnerabilities. The default value is 200.

c:simple-property.name: max-header-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum size in bytes of a http request header. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: max-headers:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of headers that will be parsed. This is used to protect against hash vulnerabilities. The default value is 200.

c:simple-property.name: max-parameters:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of parameters that will be parsed. This is used to protect against hash vulnerabilities.This applies to both query parameters, and to POST data, but is not cumulative (i.e. you can potentially have max parameters * 2 total parameters). The default value is 1000.

c:simple-property.name: max-post-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum size of a post that will be accepted. The default value is 10485760.

c:simple-property.name: no-request-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The length of time in milliseconds that the connection can be idle before it is closed by the container

c:simple-property.name: read-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: Configure a read timeout for a socket, in milliseconds. If the given amount of time elapses without a successful read taking place, the socket's next read will throw a {@link ReadTimeoutException}.

c:simple-property.name: receive-buffer:expr
c:simple-property.description: The receive buffer size.

c:simple-property.name: record-request-start-time
c:simple-property.description: If this is true then Undertow will record the request start time, to allow for request time to be logged. This has a small but measurable performance impact. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: redirect-socket
c:simple-property.description: If this listener is supporting non-SSL requests, and a request is received for which a matching <security-constraint> requires SSL transport, undertow will automatically redirect the request to the socket binding port specified here.

c:simple-property.name: request-parse-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that can be spent parsing the request

c:simple-property.name: resolve-peer-address
c:simple-property.description: Enables host dns lookup. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: scheme
c:simple-property.description: The listener scheme, can be HTTP or HTTPS. By default the scheme will be taken from the incoming AJP request.

c:simple-property.name: send-buffer:expr
c:simple-property.description: The send buffer size.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The AJP listener socket binder

c:simple-property.name: tcp-backlog:expr
c:simple-property.description: Configure a server with the specified backlog.

c:simple-property.name: tcp-keep-alive
c:simple-property.description: Configure a channel to send TCP keep-alive messages in an implementation-dependent manner.

c:simple-property.name: url-charset
c:simple-property.description: URL charset. The default value is UTF-8.

c:simple-property.name: worker
c:simple-property.description: The AJP listeners XNIO worker. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: write-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: Configure a write timeout for a socket, in milliseconds. If the given amount of time elapses without a successful write taking place, the socket's next write will throw a {@link WriteTimeoutException}.

c:list-property.name: alias
c:list-property.description: Aliases for the host

c:simple-property.name: default-response-code:expr
c:simple-property.description: If set, this will be response code sent back in case requested context does not exist on server. The default value is 404.

c:simple-property.name: default-web-module
c:simple-property.description: Default web module. The default value is ROOT.war.

c:simple-property.name: disable-console-redirect
c:simple-property.description: if set to true, /console redirect wont be enabled for this host, default is false. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: predicate
c:simple-property.description: Predicates provide a simple way of making a true/false decision based on an exchange. Many handlers have a requirement that they be applied conditionally, and predicates provide a general way to specify a condition.

c:simple-property.name: priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: Defines filter order, it should be set to 1 or more, higher number instructs server to be included earlier in handler chain than others under same context. The default value is 1.

c:simple-property.name: handler
c:simple-property.description: Default handler for this location

c:simple-property.name: predicate
c:simple-property.description: Predicates provide a simple way of making a true/false decision based on an exchange. Many handlers have a requirement that they be applied conditionally, and predicates provide a general way to specify a condition.

c:simple-property.name: priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: Defines filter order, it should be set to 1 or more, higher number instructs server to be included earlier in handler chain than others under same context. The default value is 1.

c:simple-property.name: certificate-forwarding
c:simple-property.description: If certificate forwarding should be enabled. If this is enabled then the listener will take the certificate from the SSL_CLIENT_CERT attribute. This should only be enabled if behind a proxy, and the proxy is configured to always set these headers. The default value is false.
