c:simple-property.description: The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that can be spent parsing the request

c:simple-property.name: resolve-peer-address
c:simple-property.description: Enables host dns lookup. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: security-realm
c:simple-property.description: The listeners security realm

c:simple-property.name: send-buffer:expr
c:simple-property.description: The send buffer size.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The AJP listener socket binder

c:simple-property.name: ssl-session-cache-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of active SSL sessions

c:simple-property.name: ssl-session-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout for SSL sessions, in seconds

c:simple-property.name: tcp-backlog:expr
c:simple-property.description: Configure a server with the specified backlog.

c:simple-property.name: tcp-keep-alive
c:simple-property.description: Configure a channel to send TCP keep-alive messages in an implementation-dependent manner.

c:simple-property.name: url-charset
c:simple-property.description: URL charset. The default value is UTF-8.

c:simple-property.name: verify-client
c:simple-property.description: The desired SSL client authentication mode for SSL channels. The default value is NOT_REQUESTED.

c:simple-property.name: worker
c:simple-property.description: The AJP listeners XNIO worker. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: write-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: Configure a write timeout for a socket, in milliseconds. If the given amount of time elapses without a successful write taking place, the socket's next write will throw a {@link WriteTimeoutException}.

c:simple-property.name: allow-non-standard-wrappers
c:simple-property.description: If true then request and response wrappers that do not extend the standard wrapper classes can be used. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: default-buffer-cache
c:simple-property.description: The buffer cache to use for caching static resources. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: default-encoding
c:simple-property.description: Default encoding to use for all deployed applications

c:simple-property.name: default-session-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The default session timeout (in minutes) for all applications deployed in the container. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: directory-listing
c:simple-property.description: If directory listing should be enabled for default servlets.

c:simple-property.name: disable-caching-for-secured-pages
c:simple-property.description: If Undertow should set headers to disable caching for secured paged. Disabling this can cause security problems, as sensitive pages may be cached by an intermediary. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: eager-filter-initialization
c:simple-property.description: If true undertow calls filter init() on deployment start rather than when first requested. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: ignore-flush
c:simple-property.description: Ignore flushes on the servlet output stream. In most cases these just hurt performance for no good reason. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-sessions:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of sessions that can be active at one time

c:simple-property.name: proactive-authentication
c:simple-property.description: If proactive authentication should be used. If this is true a user will always be authenticated if credentials are present. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: session-id-length:expr
c:simple-property.description: The length of the generated session ID. Longer session ID's are more secure. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: stack-trace-on-error
c:simple-property.description: If an error page with the stack trace should be generated on error. Values are all, none and local-only. The default value is local-only.

c:simple-property.name: use-listener-encoding
c:simple-property.description: Use encoding defined on listener. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: check-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: Check interval for JSP updates using a background thread. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: development
c:simple-property.description: Enable Development mode which enables reloading JSP on-the-fly. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: disabled
c:simple-property.description: Enable the JSP container. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: display-source-fragment
c:simple-property.description: When a runtime error occurs, attempts to display corresponding JSP source fragment. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: dump-smap
c:simple-property.description: Write SMAP data to a file. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: error-on-use-bean-invalid-class-attribute
c:simple-property.description: Enable errors when using a bad class in useBean. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: generate-strings-as-char-arrays
c:simple-property.description: Generate String constants as char arrays. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: java-encoding
c:simple-property.description: Specify the encoding used for Java sources. The default value is UTF8.

c:simple-property.name: keep-generated
c:simple-property.description: Keep the generated Servlets. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: mapped-file
c:simple-property.description: Map to the JSP source. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: modification-test-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: Minimum amount of time between two tests for updates, in seconds. The default value is 4.

c:simple-property.name: optimize-scriptlets
c:simple-property.description: If JSP scriptlets should be optimised to remove string concatenation. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: recompile-on-fail
c:simple-property.description: Retry failed JSP compilations on each request. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: scratch-dir
c:simple-property.description: Specify a different work directory.

c:simple-property.name: smap
c:simple-property.description: Enable SMAP. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: source-vm
c:simple-property.description: Source VM level for compilation. The default value is 1.8.

c:simple-property.name: tag-pooling
c:simple-property.description: Enable tag pooling. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: target-vm
c:simple-property.description: Target VM level for compilation. The default value is 1.8.

c:simple-property.name: trim-spaces
c:simple-property.description: Trim some spaces from the generated Servlet. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: x-powered-by
c:simple-property.description: Enable advertising the JSP engine in x-powered-by. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: buffer-pool
c:simple-property.description: The buffer pool to use for websocket deployments. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: dispatch-to-worker
c:simple-property.description: If callbacks should be dispatched to a worker thread. If this is false then they will be run in the IO thread, which is faster however care must be taken not to perform blocking operations. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: worker
c:simple-property.description: The worker to use for websocket deployments. The default value is default.

c:simple-property.name: value
c:simple-property.description: The mime type for this mapping

service.name: General JCA connectors
service.description: General settings of the JCA engine. Not necessarily for end-users

c:simple-property.name: default-workmanager-short-running-thread-pool
c:simple-property.description: Specify the name of short running thread pool

c:simple-property.name: default-workmanager-long-running-thread-pool
c:simple-property.description: Specify the name of long running thread pool

c:simple-property.name: bean-validation-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Specify whether bean validation is enabled

c:simple-property.name: archive-validation-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Enabling the validation

c:simple-property.name: archive-validation-fail-on-error
c:simple-property.description: Should an archive validation error report fail the deployment. Default: true

c:simple-property.name: archive-validation-fail-on-warn
c:simple-property.description: Should an archive validation warning report fail the deployment. Default: false

c:simple-property.name: cached-connection-manager-debug
c:simple-property.description: enable/disable debug information logging for cached connection manager

c:simple-property.name: cached-connection-manager-error
c:simple-property.description: enable/disable error information logging for cached connection manager

c:simple-property.name: modify-wsdl-address
c:simple-property.description: Whether the soap address can be modified.

c:simple-property.name: wsdl-host
c:simple-property.description: The WSDL, that is a required deployment artifact for an endpoint, has a <soap:address> element which points to the location of the endpoint. JBoss supports rewriting of that SOAP address. If the content of <soap:address> is a valid URL, JBossWS will not rewrite it unless 'modify-wsdl-address' is true. If the content of <soap:address> is not a valid URL, JBossWS will rewrite it using the attribute values given below. If 'wsdl-host' is set to 'jbossws.undefined.host', JBossWS uses requesters host when rewriting the <soap:address>

c:simple-property.name: wsdl-port
c:simple-property.description: The non-secure port that will be used for rewriting the SOAP address. If absent the port will be identified by querying the list of installed connectors.

c:simple-property.name: wsdl-secure-port
c:simple-property.description: The secure port that will be used for rewriting the SOAP address. If absent the port will be identified by querying the list of installed connectors.

c:simple-property.name: protocol-bindings
c:simple-property.description: Protocol binding

c:simple-property.description: Handler class

operation.description: Peek at the JNDI tree

service.name: Binding
service.description: JNDI bindings for primitive types

c:simple-property.name: binding-type
c:simple-property.description: The type of binding to create, may be simple, lookup or object-factory

c:simple-property.name: class
c:simple-property.description: The object factory class name for object factory bindings

c:simple-property.name: lookup
c:simple-property.description: The entry to lookup in JNDI for lookup bindings

c:simple-property.name: module
c:simple-property.description: The module to load the object factory from for object factory bindings

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The type of the value to bind for simple bindings, this must be a primitive type

c:simple-property.name: value
c:simple-property.description: The value to bind for simple bindings

service.name: Transactions Subsystem (Standalone)
service.description: The transactions subsystem.

metric.description: The total number of nested (sub) transactions created.
The number of transactions that have rolled back due to timeout.
The number of committed transactions.
The total number of transactions (top-level and nested) created
The number of transactions which have terminated with heuristic outcomes.
The number of aborted (i.e. rolledback) transactions.
The number of transactions that have begun but not yet terminated.

The number of transactions that have been rolled back by application request. This includes those that timeout, since the timeout behaviour is considered an attribute of the application configuration.
The number of transactions that rolled back due to resource (participant) failure.

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description: References a global path configuration in the domain model, defaulting to the JBoss Application Server data directory (jboss.server.data.dir). The value of the 'path' attribute will treated as relative to this path. Use an empty string to disable the default behavior and force the value of the 'path' attribute to be treated as an absolute path. The default value is jboss.server.data.dir.

c:simple-property.name: process-id-uuid
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transaction manager should use a UUID based process id.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: Used to reference the correct socket binding to use for the recovery environment.

c:simple-property.name: jts
c:simple-property.description: If true this enables the Java Transaction Service. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: object-store-path
c:simple-property.description: Denotes a relative or absolute filesystem path denoting where the transaction manager object store should store data. By default the value is treated as relative to the path denoted by the 'relative-to' attribute. The default value is tx-object-store.

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: Denotes a relative or absolute filesystem path denoting where the transaction manager core should store data. By default the value is treated as relative to the path denoted by the 'relative-to' attribute. The default value is var.

c:simple-property.name: process-id-socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket binding configuration to use if the transaction manager should use a socket-based process id. Will be 'undefined' if 'process-id-uuid' is 'true'; otherwise must be set.

c:simple-property.name: default-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The default timeout. The default value is 300.

c:simple-property.name: process-id-socket-max-ports
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of ports to search for an open port if the transaction manager should use a socket-based process id. If the port specified by the socket binding referenced in 'process-id-socket-binding' is occupied, the next higher port will be tried until an open port is found or the number of ports specified by this attribute have been tried. Will be 'undefined' if 'process-id-uuid' is 'true'. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: recovery-listener
c:simple-property.description: Used to specify if the recovery system should listen on a network socket or not. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: status-socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: Used to reference the correct socket binding to use for the transaction status manager.

c:simple-property.name: node-identifier
c:simple-property.description: Used to set the node identifier on the core environment. The default value is 1.

c:simple-property.name: enable-tsm-status
c:simple-property.description: Whether the transaction status manager (TSM) service, needed for out of process recovery, should be provided or not. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: object-store-relative-to
c:simple-property.description: References a global path configuration in the domain model, defaulting to the JBoss Application Server data directory (jboss.server.data.dir). The value of the 'path' attribute will treated as relative to this path. Use an empty string to disable the default behavior and force the value of the 'path' attribute to be treated as an absolute path. The default value is jboss.server.data.dir.

c:simple-property.name: enable-statistics
c:simple-property.description: Whether statistics should be enabled. The default value is false.

service.name: Log Store (Standalone)
service.description: Representation of the transaction logging storage mechanism.

operation.name: subsystem:probe
operation.description: Scan for new transaction logs. This operation will creates a child for each pending transaction.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Scan for new transaction logs. This operation will creates a child for each pending transaction.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the implementation type of the logging store.

service.name: Transactions (Standalone)
service.description: The persistent information that the transaction manager stores for the purpose of recovering a transaction in the event of failure. The probe operation will add and remove transactions from the model as the corresponding real transactions start and finish the prepare and commit phases. A stuck transaction will remain in the model until either it is completed or explicitly removed by the delete operation.

operation.name: subsystem:delete
operation.description: Remove this transaction log. WARNING after this operation the transaction manager will have no knowledge of the transaction and will therefore never be able to recover it. If you are sure that the transaction is complete then the operation is safe. The representation of the transaction log is removed from the model too.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Remove this transaction log. WARNING after this operation the transaction manager will have no knowledge of the transaction and will therefore never be able to recover it. If you are sure that the transaction is complete then the operation is safe. The representation of the transaction log is removed from the model too.

c:simple-property.name: age-in-seconds
c:simple-property.description: The time since this transaction was prepared or when the recovery system last tried to recover it.

c:simple-property.name: id
c:simple-property.description: The id of this transaction.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-name
c:simple-property.description: The JMX name of this transaction.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The type name under which this record is stored.

service.name: Participants (Standalone)
service.description: The resources that did work in a transaction.

operation.name: subsystem:recover
operation.description: If this record is in a heuristic state then attempt to replay the commit phase of the 2PC transaction.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: If this record is in a heuristic state then attempt to replay the commit phase of the 2PC transaction.

operation.name: subsystem:refresh
operation.description: Refresh the management view of the attributes of this participant record by querying the transaction log. (Note that the read-resource operaton only reads the model, hence the need for this refresh operation).

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Refresh the management view of the attributes of this participant record by querying the transaction log. (Note that the read-resource operaton only reads the model, hence the need for this refresh operation).

c:simple-property.name: eis-product-name
c:simple-property.description: The JCA enterprise information system's product name.

c:simple-property.name: eis-product-version
c:simple-property.description: The JCA enterprise information system's product version

c:simple-property.name: jmx-name
c:simple-property.description: The JMX name of this participant.

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: JNDI name of this participant.

c:simple-property.name: status
c:simple-property.description: Reports the commitment status of this participant (can be one of Pending, Prepared, Failed, Heuristic or Readonly).

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The type name under which this record is stored.

service.name: Network Interface
service.description: A named network interface, along with required criteria for determining the IP address to associate with that interface

c:simple-property.name: inet-address
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address matches the given value. Value is either a IP address in IPv6 or IPv4 dotted decimal notation, or a hostname that can be resolved to an IP address. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:group.name: address
c:group.displayName: Wildcard selection (exactly one property must be set to true)

c:simple-property.name: any-address
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that sockets using this interface should be bound to a wildcard address. The IPv6 wildcard address (::) will be used unless the java.net.preferIpV4Stack system property is set to true, in which case the IPv4 wildcard address (0.0.0.0) will be used. If a socket is bound to an IPv6 anylocal address on a dual-stack machine, it can accept both IPv6 and IPv4 traffic; if it is bound to an IPv4 (IPv4-mapped) anylocal address, it can only accept IPv4 traffic.

c:simple-property.name: link-local-address
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address is link-local. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:simple-property.name: loopback
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not it is a loopback address. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:simple-property.name: loopback-address
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that the IP address for this interface should be the given value, if a loopback interface exists on the machine. A 'loopback address' may not actually be configured on the machine's loopback interface. Differs from inet-address in that the given value will be used even if no NIC can be found that has the IP specified address associated with it. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:simple-property.name: multicast
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not its network interface supports multicast. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:simple-property.name: nic
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface has the given name. The name of a network interface (e.g. eth0, eth1, lo). An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:simple-property.name: nic-match
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface has a name that matches the given regular expression. Value is a regular expression against which the names of the network interfaces available on the machine can be matched to find an acceptable interface. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:simple-property.name: point-to-point
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not its network interface is a point-to-point interface. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

c:simple-property.name: public-address
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not it is a publicly routable address. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

c:simple-property.name: site-local-address
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or it is a site-local address. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

c:simple-property.name: subnet-match
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or it the address fits in the given subnet definition. Value is a network IP address and the number of bits in the address' network prefix, written in 'slash notation'; e.g. '192.168.0.0/16'. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

c:simple-property.name: up
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is currently up. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

c:simple-property.name: virtual
c:simple-property.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is a virtual interface. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

c:simple-property.name: default-interface
c:simple-property.description: Default Interface for these bindings. See Network Interfaces for its definition

c:simple-property.name: port-offset
c:simple-property.description: Offset from standard ports for this group. This is only available in standalone mode

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket. Services which need to access the socket configuration information will find it using this name.

c:simple-property.name: interface
c:simple-property.description: Name of the interface to which the socket should be bound, or, for multicast sockets, the interface on which it should listen. This should be one of the declared interfaces.

c:simple-property.name: port:expr
c:simple-property.description: Number of the port to which the socket should be bound. ${} Expresions are allowed. Can be omitted if multicast-port is set.

c:simple-property.name: fixed-port
c:simple-property.description: Whether the port value should remain fixed even if numeric offsets are applied to the other sockets in the socket group.

c:simple-property.name: multicast-address
c:simple-property.description: Multicast address on which the socket should receive multicast traffic. If unspecified, the socket will not be configured to receive multicast.

c:simple-property.name: multicast-port:expr
c:simple-property.description: Port on which the socket should receive multicast traffic. Must be configured if 'multicast-address' is configured. ${} Expresions are allowed.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket binding. Services which need to access the socket configuration information will find it using this name.

c:simple-property.name: port:expr
c:simple-property.description: The port number of the remote destination to which the outbound socket should connect. ${} Expresions are allowed.

c:simple-property.name: host
c:simple-property.description: The host name or the IP address of the remote destination to which this outbound socket will connect.

c:simple-property.name: source-interface
c:simple-property.description: The name of the interface which will be used for the source address of the outbound socket.

c:simple-property.name: source-port:expr
c:simple-property.description: The port number which will be used as the source port of the outbound socket.. ${} Expresions are allowed.

c:simple-property.name: fixed-source-port
c:simple-property.description: Whether the port value should remain fixed even if numeric offsets are applied to the other outbound sockets in the socket group.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket binding. Services which need to access the socket configuration information will find it using this name.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding-ref
c:simple-property.description: The name of the local socket-binding which will be used to determine the port to which this outbound socket connects.

c:simple-property.name: source-interface
c:simple-property.description: The name of the interface which will be used for the source address of the outbound socket.

c:simple-property.name: source-port:expr
c:simple-property.description: The port number which will be used as the source port of the outbound socket.. ${} Expresions are allowed.

c:simple-property.name: fixed-source-port
c:simple-property.description: Whether the port value should remain fixed even if numeric offsets are applied to the other outbound sockets in the socket group.

metric.description: The current runtime status of a deployment. Possible status modes are OK, FAILED, and STOPPED. FAILED indicates a dependency is missing or a service could not start. STOPPED indicates that the deployment was manually stopped.

c:simple-property.name: runtimeName
c:simple-property.description: Runtime name of the uploaded file (e.g. 'my.war'). If not present, the file name is used.

c:list-property.name: content
c:list-property.description: List of pieces of content that comprise the deployment.

c:simple-property.name: input-stream-index
c:simple-property.description: The index into the operation's attached input streams of the input stream that contains deployment content that should be uploaded to the domain's or standalone server's deployment content repository.

c:simple-property.name: hash
c:simple-property.description: The hash of managed deployment content that has been uploaded to the domain's or standalone server's deployment content repository.

c:simple-property.name: bytes
c:simple-property.description: Byte array containing the deployment content that should uploaded to the domain's or standalone server's deployment content repository.

c:simple-property.name: url
c:simple-property.description: The URL at which the deployment content is available for upload to the domain's or standalone server's deployment content repository.. Note that the URL must be accessible from the target of the operation (i.e. the Domain Controller or standalone server).

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: Path (relative or absolute) to unmanaged content that is part of the deployment.

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description: Name of a system path to which the value of the 'path' is relative. If not set, the 'path' is considered to be absolute.

c:simple-property.name: archive
c:simple-property.description: Flag indicating whether unmanaged content is a zip archive (true) or exploded (false).

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Boolean indicating whether the deployment content is currently deployed in the runtime (or should be deployed in the runtime the next time the server starts.)

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: Unique identifier of the deployment. Must be unique across all deployments.

c:simple-property.name: persistent
c:simple-property.description: Boolean indicating whether the existence of the deployment should be recorded in the persistent server configuration. Only relevant to a standalone mode server. Default is 'true'. A deployment managed by a deployment scanner would have this set to 'false' to ensure the deployment is only deployed at server start if the scanner again detects the deployment.

c:simple-property.name: runtime-name
c:simple-property.description: Name by which the deployment should be known within a server runtime. This would be equivalent to the file name of a deployment file, and would form the basis for such things as default Java Enterprise Edition application and module names. This would typically be the same as 'name', but in some cases users may wish to have two deployments with the same runtime-name (e.g. two versions of foo.war) both available in the deployment content repository, in which case the deployments would need to have distinct name; values but would have the same runtime-name.

service.name: Subdeployment
service.description: Runtime resources associated with a child deployment packaged inside another deployment; for example a war packaged inside an ear.

service.name: Resource Adapters Runtime
service.description: Configuration of the resource adapters subsystem.

service.name: Connection Definition Runtime
service.description: Specifies the connection definitions.

metric.description: The active count
The available count
The average time spent blocking for a connection
The average time spent creating a physical connection
The created count
The destroyed count
The maximum time for creating a physical connection
The maximum number of connections used
The maximum wait time for a connection
The timed out count
The total blocking time
The total time spent creating physical connections

service.name: Web Runtime
service.description: Runtime resources exposed by web components in the deployment.

c:simple-property.name: responseTimeLogFile
c:simple-property.description: the full path to the log file containing response-time stats for this webapp

c:simple-property.name: responseTimeUrlExcludes
c:simple-property.description: a space-delimited list of regular expressions specifying URLs that should be excluded from response-time stats collection

c:simple-property.name: responseTimeUrlTransforms
c:simple-property.description: a space-delimited list of Perl-style substitution expressions that should be applied to all URLs for which response-time stats are collected (e.g. |^/dept/finance/.*|/dept/finance/*|)

metric.description: the virtual host this webapp is deployed to
the context root of this webapp
The name of server this application belongs to
the minimum, maximum, and average response times for requests serviced by this webapp
The number of sessions that are currently active
The number of expired sessions
The maximum number of sessions that have been active
The number of sessions rejected
The average alive time of sessions
The maximum alive time of sessions
The number of sessions created

service.name: Datasources Runtime
service.description: Runtime resources exposed by data sources included in this deployment.

service.name: XA Datasource Runtime
service.description: A JDBC XA data-source configuration

service.name: Datasource Runtime
service.description: A JDBC data-source configuration

service.name: Messaging Runtime
service.description: Runtime resources exposed by messaging resources included in this deployment.

service.name: ActiveMQ Artemis Server Runtime
service.description: A ActiveMQ Artemis server instance.

operation.name: subsystem:close-connections-for-address
operation.description: Closes all the connections of clients connected to this server whose remote address contains the specified IP address.

c:simple-property.name: ip-address
c:simple-property.description: An IP address in string format.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: True if any connections were closed, false otherwise.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: True if any connections were closed, false otherwise.

operation.name: subsystem:close-consumer-connections-for-address
operation.description: Closes all the connections of consumers that are consuming from queues bound to the specified address.

c:simple-property.name: address-match
c:simple-property.description: An ActiveMQ address match.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: True if any connections were closed, false otherwise.

metric.description: Whether the server is active (and accepting connections) or passive (in backup mode, waiting for failover).
Whether this server is started.
The server's version.

c:simple-property.name: async-connection-execution-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether incoming packets on the server should be handed off to a thread from the thread pool for processing. False if they should be handled on the remoting thread. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-password
c:simple-property.description: The password used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is CHANGE ME!!.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-user
c:simple-property.description: The user used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is ACTIVEMQ.CLUSTER.ADMIN.USER.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl-override:expr
c:simple-property.description: If set, this will override how long (in ms) to keep a connection alive without receiving a ping. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: create-bindings-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the bindings directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: create-journal-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the journal directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: id-cache-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size of the cache for pre-creating message IDs. The default value is 20000.

c:list-property.name: incoming-interceptors
c:list-property.description: The list of incoming interceptor classes used by this server.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-domain
c:simple-property.description: The JMX domain used to register internal ActiveMQ MBeans in the MBeanServer. The default value is org.apache.activemq.artemis.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-management-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether ActiveMQ should expose its internal management API via JMX. This is not recommended, as accessing these MBeans can lead to inconsistent configuration. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size of the internal buffer on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout (in nanoseconds) used to flush internal buffers on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-min-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: The minimal number of journal data files before we can start compacting. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-percentage:expr
c:simple-property.description: The percentage of live data on which we consider compacting the journal. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: journal-file-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size (in bytes) of each journal file. The default value is 10485760.

c:simple-property.name: journal-max-io:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of write requests that can be in the AIO queue at any one time.

c:simple-property.name: journal-min-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: How many journal files to pre-create. The default value is 2.

c:simple-property.name: journal-pool-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of journal files that can be reused. ActiveMQ will create as many files as needed however when reclaiming files it will shrink back to the value (-1 means no limit). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-non-transactional
c:simple-property.description: Whether to wait for non transaction data to be synced to the journal before returning a response to the client. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-transactional
c:simple-property.description: Whether to wait for transaction data to be synchronized to the journal before returning a response to the client. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: journal-type
c:simple-property.description: The type of journal to use. The default value is ASYNCIO.

c:simple-property.name: log-journal-write-rate
c:simple-property.description: Whether to periodically log the journal's write rate and flush rate. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: management-address
c:simple-property.description: Address to send management messages to. The default value is jms.queue.activemq.management.

c:simple-property.name: management-notification-address
c:simple-property.description: The name of the address that consumers bind to to receive management notifications. The default value is activemq.notifications.

c:simple-property.name: memory-measure-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: Frequency to sample JVM memory in ms (or -1 to disable memory sampling). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: memory-warning-threshold:expr
c:simple-property.description: Percentage of available memory which if exceeded results in a warning log. The default value is 25.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-max-day-history:expr
c:simple-property.description: How many days to keep message counter history. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-sample-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: The sample period (in ms) to use for message counters. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: message-expiry-scan-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often (in ms) to scan for expired messages. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: message-expiry-thread-priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: The priority of the thread expiring messages. The default value is 3.

c:list-property.name: outgoing-interceptors
c:list-property.description: The list of outgoing interceptor classes used by this server.

c:simple-property.name: override-in-vm-security
c:simple-property.description: Whether the ActiveMQ server will override security credentials for in-vm connections. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: page-max-concurrent-io:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of concurrent reads allowed on paging. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: perf-blast-pages:expr
c:simple-property.description: TODO. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: persist-delivery-count-before-delivery
c:simple-property.description: Whether the delivery count is persisted before delivery. False means that this only happens after a message has been cancelled. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: persist-id-cache
c:simple-property.description: Whether IDs are persisted to the journal. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: persistence-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server will use the file based journal for persistence. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: run-sync-speed-test
c:simple-property.description: Whether on startup to perform a diagnostic test on how fast your disk can sync. Useful when determining performance issues. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: scheduled-thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of threads that the main scheduled thread pool has. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The security domain to use to verify user and role information. The default value is other.

c:simple-property.name: security-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether security is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: security-invalidation-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: How long (in ms) to wait before invalidating the security cache. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: server-dump-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often to dump basic runtime information to the server log. A value less than 1 disables this feature. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: statistics-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether gathering of statistics such as message counters are enabled. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of threads that the main thread pool has. -1 means no limit. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: How long (in ms) before a transaction can be removed from the resource manager after create time. The default value is 300000.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-timeout-scan-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often (in ms) to scan for timeout transactions. The default value is 1000.

c:simple-property.name: wild-card-routing-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server supports wild card routing. The default value is true.

operation.name: subsystem:change-message-priority

service.name: DeploymentScanner
service.description: Management of the deployment scanner

c:list-property.description: List of scanners

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the scanner

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: The actual filesystem path to be scanned. Treated as an absolute path, unless the 'relative-to' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description: Reference to a filesystem path defined in the 'paths' section of the server configuration.

c:simple-property.name: scan-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Flag indicating that all scanning (including initial scanning at startup) should be disabled.

c:simple-property.name: scan-interval
c:simple-property.description: Periodic interval, in milliseconds, at which the repository should be scanned for changes. A value of less than 1 indicates the repository should only be scanned at initial startup.

c:simple-property.name: auto-deploy-zipped
c:simple-property.description: Controls whether zipped deployment content should be automatically deployed by the scanner without requiring the user to add a .dodeploy marker file.

c:simple-property.name: auto-deploy-exploded
c:simple-property.description: Controls whether zipped deployment content should be automatically deployed by the scanner without requiring the user to add a .dodeploy marker file. Setting this to 'true' is not recommended for anything but basic development scenarios, as there is no way to ensure that deployment will not occur in the middle of changes to the content.

c:simple-property.name: deployment-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Timeout, in seconds, a deployment is allows to execute before being canceled. The default is 60 seconds.

service.name: JacORB
service.description: JacORB subsystem configuration

c:simple-property.name: add-component-via-interceptor
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether SSL components should be added by an IOR interceptor (on) or not (off). The default value is on.

c:simple-property.name: cache-poa-names
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether POA names should be cached (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: cache-typecodes
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether typecodes should be cached (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: chunk-custom-rmi-valuetypes
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether custom RMI valuetypes should be encoded as chunks (on) or not (off). The default value is on.

c:simple-property.name: client-requires
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the client SSL required parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is None.

c:simple-property.name: client-supports
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the client SSL supported parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is MutualAuth.

c:simple-property.name: client-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The client-side connection timeout value in milliseconds. A value of zero indicates that the connection never times out. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: comet
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether interoperability with Comet's ORB is enabled (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: export-corbaloc
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the root context should be exported as corbaloc::address:port/NameService (on) or not (off). The default value is on.

c:simple-property.name: giop-minor-version
c:simple-property.description: The GIOP minor version to be used. The default value is 2.

c:simple-property.name: indirection-encoding-disable
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether indirection encoding for repeated typecodes should be disabled (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: iona
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether interoperability with IONA's ASP is enabled (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: lax-boolean-encoding
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether any non-zero CDR encoded boolean value should be interpreted as true (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: max-managed-buf-size
c:simple-property.description: The log2 of maximum size managed by the internal buffer manager. The default value is 24.

c:simple-property.name: max-server-connections
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of connections accepted by the server. The default value is 2147483647.

c:simple-property.name: max-threads
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of active request processor threads. Threads are first obtained from the pool and once the pool is exhausted new threads are created until the number of threads reaches this limit. New requests will wait until an active thread finishes its job. The default value is 32.

c:simple-property.name: monitoring
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the monitoring GUI should be displayed (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the running ORB. The default value is JBoss.

c:simple-property.name: outbuf-cache-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The buffer cache timeout in milliseconds. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: outbuf-size
c:simple-property.description: The size of the network buffers for outgoing messages. The default value is 2048.

c:simple-property.name: pool-size
c:simple-property.description: The size of the request processors thread-pool. Threads that finish processing a request are placed back in the pool if the pool is not full and discarded otherwise. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: print-version
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the version number should be printed during ORB startup (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:list-property.name: properties
c:list-property.description: A list of generic key/value properties.

c:simple-property.name: queue-max
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of requests that can be queued. The default value is 100.

c:simple-property.name: queue-min
c:simple-property.description: The size of the queue for notifying waiting requests. In other words, blocked requests are only notified when the queue has no more than queue-min requests. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: queue-wait
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether requests that exceed the maximum queue size should wait (on) or not (off). When disabled, a TRANSIENT exception is thrown if the queue is full. The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: retries
c:simple-property.description: The number of retries if connections cannot be promptly established. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The interval in milliseconds between retries. The default value is 500.

c:simple-property.name: root-context
c:simple-property.description: The naming service root context. The default value is JBoss/Naming/root.

c:simple-property.name: security
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the security interceptors are to be installed (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The name of the security domain that holds the key and trust stores that will be used to establish SSL connections.

c:simple-property.name: server-requires
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the server SSL required parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is None.

c:simple-property.name: server-supports
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the server SSL supported parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is MutualAuth.

c:simple-property.name: server-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The server-side connection timeout value in milliseconds. A value of zero indicates that the connection never times out. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: strict-check-on-tc-creation
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the method create_abstract_interface_tc should perform a validation check on the name parameter (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: sun
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether interoperability with Sun's ORB is enabled (on) or not (off). The default value is on.

c:simple-property.name: support-ssl
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether SSL is to be supported (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: transactions
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transactions interceptors are to be installed (on or spec) or not (off). The value 'on' enabled JTS while 'spec' enables a spec compliant mode (non JTS) that rejects incoming transaction contexts. The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: use-bom
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether GIOP 1.2 byte order markers should be used (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

c:simple-property.name: use-imr
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the implementation repository should be used (on) or not (off). The default value is off.

service.name: JDR
service.description: JBoss Diagnostic Reporter (JDR) Subsystem.

operation.name: generate-jdr-report
operation.description: Request the generation of a JDR report.

service.name: JCA
service.description: The Java EE Connector Architecture (JCA) subsystem providing general configuration for resource adapters

c:simple-property.name: enabled:1
c:simple-property.description: Specify whether bean validation is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: enabled:2
c:simple-property.description: Specify whether archive validation is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: fail-on-error

c:simple-property.name: install
c:simple-property.description: Enable/disable the cached connection manager valve and interceptor. The default value is false.

metric.description: The current number of threads in the pool.

service.name: EE
service.description: The configuration of the EE subsystem.

c:simple-property.name: ear-subdeployments-isolated
c:simple-property.description: Flag indicating whether each of the subdeployments within a .ear can access classes belonging to another subdeployment within the same .ear. A value of false means the subdeployments can see classes belonging to other subdeployments within the .ear. The default value is false.

c:list-property.name: global-modules
c:list-property.description: A list of modules that should be made available to all deployments.

service.name: Security
service.description: The configuration of the security subsystem.

c:simple-property.name: deep-copy-subject-mode
c:simple-property.description: Sets the copy mode of subjects done by the security managers to be deep copies that makes copies of the subject principals and credentials if they are cloneable. It should be set to true if subject include mutable content that can be corrupted when multiple threads have the same identity and cache flushes/logout clearing the subject in one thread results in subject references affecting other threads. The default value is false.

operation.name: flush-cache
operation.description: Remove entries stored in the authentication cache for this security domain. A single entry can be flushed by using the principal argument with the username as the value. If no argument is passed to the operation, all entries are flushed.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Remove entries stored in the authentication cache for this security domain. A single entry can be flushed by using the principal argument with the username as the value. If no argument is passed to the operation, all entries are flushed.

operation.name: list-cached-principals
operation.description: Lists the principals stored in the authentication cache for this security domain.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Lists the principals stored in the authentication cache for this security domain.

c:simple-property.name: cache-type
c:simple-property.description: Adds a cache to speed up authentication checks. Allowed values are 'default' to use simple map as the cache and 'infinispan' to use an Infinispan cache.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: cipher-suites
c:simple-property.description: Comma separated list of cipher suites to enable on SSLSockets.

c:simple-property.name: client-alias
c:simple-property.description: Preferred alias to use when the KeyManager chooses the client alias.

c:simple-property.name: client-auth
c:simple-property.description: Boolean attribute to indicate if client's certificates should also be authenticated on the server side.

c:simple-property.name: algorithm
c:simple-property.description: Algorithm to use when creating the KeyManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the KeyManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Sets the password of the keystore. Either this or 'truststore-password' must be present otherwise the security domain will be useless.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the keystore. If not set, type defaults to 'JKS'.

c:simple-property.name: url
c:simple-property.description: URL of the keystore.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the KeyStore.

c:simple-property.name: provider-argument
c:simple-property.description: String argument to pass to the keystore Provider constructor when instantiating it.

c:simple-property.name: protocols
c:simple-property.description: Comma separated list of protocols to enable on SSLSockets.

c:simple-property.name: server-alias
c:simple-property.description: Preferred alias to use when the KeyManager chooses the server alias.

c:simple-property.name: service-auth-token
c:simple-property.description: Token to retrieve PrivateKeys from the KeyStore.

c:simple-property.name: algorithm
c:simple-property.description: Algorithm to use when creating the TrustManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the TrustManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Sets the password of the truststore. Either this or 'keystore-password' must be present otherwise the security domain will be useless.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the truststore. If not set, type defaults to 'JKS'.

c:simple-property.name: url
c:simple-property.description: URL of the truststore.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the truststore.

c:simple-property.name: provider-argument
c:simple-property.description: String argument to pass to the truststore Provider constructor when instantiating it.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of mapping this module performs. Allowed values are principal, role, attribute or credential..

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of mapping this module performs. Allowed values are principal, role, attribute or credential..

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Fully Qualified Name of the Security Vault Implementation.

service.name: ThreadFactory
service.description: A thread factory (implementing java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory).

c:simple-property.name: group-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the name of a thread group to create for this thread factory.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the created thread factory.

c:simple-property.name: priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: May be used to specify the thread priority of created threads. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: thread-name-pattern
c:simple-property.description: The template used to create names for threads. The following patterns may be used: %% - emit a percent sign %t - emit the per-factory thread sequence number %g - emit the global thread sequence number %f - emit the factory sequence number %i - emit the thread ID.

service.name: ThreadPool
service.description: A thread pool executor

metric.description: The approximate number of threads that are actively executing tasks.
The approximate total number of tasks that have completed execution.
The current number of threads in the pool.
The largest number of threads that have ever simultaneously been in the pool.
The number of tasks that have been rejected.
The approximate total number of tasks that have ever been scheduled for execution.

service.name: EJB3
service.description: The configuration of the ejb3 subsystem.

c:simple-property.name: default-clustered-sfsb-cache
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default stateful bean cache, which will be applicable to all clustered stateful EJBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-entity-bean-instance-pool
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default entity bean instance pool, which will be applicable to all entity beans, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-entity-bean-optimistic-locking
c:simple-property.description: If set to true entity beans will use optimistic locking by default

c:simple-property.name: default-mdb-instance-pool
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default MDB instance pool, which will be applicable to all MDBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-resource-adapter-name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default resource adapter name that will be used by MDBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level. The default value is activemq-ra.

c:simple-property.name: default-sfsb-cache
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default stateful bean cache, which will be applicable to all stateful EJBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-singleton-bean-access-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The default access timeout for singleton beans. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: default-slsb-instance-pool
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default stateless bean instance pool, which will be applicable to all stateless EJBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-stateful-bean-access-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The default access timeout for stateful beans. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: in-vm-remote-interface-invocation-pass-by-value
c:simple-property.description: If set to false, the parameters to invocations on remote interface of an EJB, will be passed by reference. Else, the parameters will be passed by value. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: enable-statistics
c:simple-property.description: If set to true, enable the collection of invocation statistics.

service.name: EJB3 Thread Pool
service.description: A thread pool executor with an unbounded queue. Such a thread pool has a core size and a queue with no upper bound. When a task is submitted, if the number of running threads is less than the core size, a new thread is created. Otherwise, the task is placed in queue. If too many tasks are allowed to be submitted to this type of executor, an out of memory condition may occur.

metric.description: The approximate number of threads that are actively executing tasks.
The approximate total number of tasks that have completed execution.
The current number of threads in the pool.
The largest number of threads that have ever simultaneously been in the pool.
The number of tasks that have been rejected.
The approximate total number of tasks that have ever been scheduled for execution.

c:map-property.name: keepalive-time
c:map-property.description: Used to specify the amount of time that pool threads should be kept running when idle; if not specified, threads will run until the executor is shut down.

c:simple-property.name: time
c:simple-property.description: The time

c:simple-property.name: unit
c:simple-property.description: The time unit

c:simple-property.name: max-threads:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum thread pool size.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the thread pool.

c:simple-property.name: thread-factory
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the name of a specific thread factory to use to create worker threads. If not defined an appropriate default thread factory will be used.

service.name: File Passivation Store
service.description: A file system based passivation store.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout in units specified by idle-timeout-unit, after which a bean will passivate. The default value is 300.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-unit
c:simple-property.description: The unit of idle-timeout. The default value is SECONDS.

c:simple-property.name: max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of beans this cache should store before forcing old beans to passivate. The default value is 10000.

service.name: Strict Max Bean Instance Pool
service.description: A bean instance pool with a strict upper limit

c:simple-property.name: derive-size
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if and what the max pool size should be derived from. A value of 'none', the default, indicates that the explicit value of max-pool-size should be used. A value of 'from-worker-pools' indicates that the max pool size should be derived from the size of the total threads for all worker pools configured on the system. A value of 'from-cpu-count' indicates that the max pool size should be derived from the total number of processors available on the system. Note that the computation isn't a 1:1 mapping, the values may or may not be augmented by other factors. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: max-pool-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of bean instances that the pool can hold at a given point in time. The default value is 20.

c:simple-property.name: timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a bean instance to be available from the pool. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: timeout-unit
c:simple-property.description: The instance acquisition timeout unit. The default value is MINUTES.

service.name: SFSB Cache
service.description: A SFSB cache.

c:list-property.name: aliases
c:list-property.description: The aliases by which this cache may also be referenced

c:simple-property.name: passivation-store
c:simple-property.description: The passivation store used by this cache

service.name: Cluster Passivation Store
service.description: A clustered passivation store.

c:simple-property.name: bean-cache
c:simple-property.description: The name of the cache used to store bean instances.

c:simple-property.name: cache-container
c:simple-property.description: The name of the cache container used for the bean and client-mappings caches. The default value is ejb.

c:simple-property.name: client-mappings-cache
c:simple-property.description: The name of the cache used to store client-mappings of the EJB remoting connector's socket-bindings. The default value is remote-connector-client-mappings.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout in units specified by idle-timeout-unit, after which a bean will passivate. The default value is 300.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-unit
c:simple-property.description: The unit of idle-timeout. The default value is SECONDS.

c:simple-property.name: max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of beans this cache should store before forcing old beans to passivate. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: passivate-events-on-replicate
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether replication should trigger passivation events on the bean. The default value is true.

service.name: Async Service
service.description: The EJB3 Asynchronous Invocation Service

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the thread pool which handles asynchronous invocations

service.name: IIOP-OpenJDK Service
service.description: The IIOP-OpenJDK service

c:simple-property.name: add-component-via-interceptor
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether SSL components should be added by an IOR interceptor (on) or not (off). The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: auth-method
c:simple-property.description: The authentication method. Valid values are 'none' and 'username_password'. The default value is username_password.

c:simple-property.name: caller-propagation
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the caller identity should be propagated in the SAS context or not. Valid values are 'none' and 'supported'. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: client-requires
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the client SSL required parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is None.

c:simple-property.name: client-supports
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the client SSL supported parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is MutualAuth.

c:simple-property.name: confidentiality
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transport must require confidentiality protection or not. Valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: detect-misordering
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transport must require misordering detection or not. Valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: detect-replay
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transport must require replay detection or not. Valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: export-corbaloc
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the root context should be exported as corbaloc::address:port/NameService (on) or not (off). The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: giop-version
c:simple-property.description: The GIOP version to be used. The default value is 1.2.

c:simple-property.name: high-water-mark:expr
c:simple-property.description: TCP connection cache parameter. Each time the number of connections exceeds this value ORB tries to reclaim connections. Number of reclaimed connections is specified by tcp-number-to-reclaim property. If this property is not set then it is configured as OpenJDK ORB default.

c:simple-property.name: integrity
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transport must require integrity protection or not. Valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: number-to-reclaim:expr
c:simple-property.description: TCP connection cache parameter. Each time number of connections exceeds tcp-high-water-mark property then ORB tries to reclaim connections. Number of reclaimed connections is specified by this property. If it is not set then it is configured as OpenJDK ORB default.

c:simple-property.name: persistent-server-id
c:simple-property.description: Persistent id of the server. Persistent object references are valid across many activactions of the server and they identify it using this property. As a result of that: many activations of the same server should have this property set to the same value, different server instances running on the same host should have different server ids. The default value is 1.

c:map-property.name: properties
c:map-property.description: A list of generic key/value properties.

c:simple-property.name: realm
c:simple-property.description: The authentication service (AS) realm name.

c:simple-property.name: required
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if authentication is required (true) or not (false). The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: root-context
c:simple-property.description: The naming service root context. The default value is JBoss/Naming/root.

c:simple-property.name: security
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the security interceptors are to be installed (on) or not (off). The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The name of the security domain that holds the key and trust stores that will be used to establish SSL connections.

c:simple-property.name: server-requires
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the server SSL required parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is None.

c:simple-property.name: server-supports
c:simple-property.description: Value that indicates the server SSL supported parameters (None, ServerAuth, ClientAuth, MutualAuth). The default value is MutualAuth.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket binding configuration that specifies the ORB port. The default value is iiop.

c:simple-property.name: ssl-socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The name of the socket binding configuration that specifies the ORB SSL port. The default value is iiop-ssl.

c:simple-property.name: support-ssl
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether SSL is to be supported (on) or not (off). The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: transactions
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether the transactions interceptors are to be installed (on or spec) or not (off). The value 'on' enabled JTS while 'spec' enables a spec compliant mode (non JTS) that rejects incoming transaction contexts. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: trust-in-client
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if the transport must require trust in client to be established. Valid values are 'none', 'supported' and 'required'. The default value is none.

c:simple-property.name: trust-in-target
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if the transport must require trust in target to be established. Valid values are 'none' and 'supported'. The default value is none.

service.name: Remote Service

c:simple-property.description: The name of the connector on which the EJB3 remoting channel is registered

c:simple-property.description: The value for the EJB remote channel creation option
