c:simple-property.description: The relative path that is used to resolve the timer data store location

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the thread pool used to run timer service invocations

service.name: JMX
service.description: The configuration of the JMX subsystem.

c:simple-property.name: show-model
c:simple-property.description: Set to 'true' to include MBeans for the model controller resources

service.name: Remoting Connector
service.description: The configuration of a resource adapter.

c:simple-property.name: use-management-endpoint
c:simple-property.description: If true the connector will use the management endpoint, otherwise it will use the remoting subsystem one. The default value is true.

service.name: Resource Adapters
service.description: Configuration of the resource adapters subsystem.

service.name: Resource Adapter
service.description: The configuration of a resource adapter.

c:simple-property.name: archive
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the resource adapter archive

c:simple-property.name: beanvalidationgroups
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the bean validation groups that should be used

c:simple-property.name: bootstrapcontext
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the unique name of the bootstrap context that should be used

c:simple-property.name: transaction-support
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the transaction support level of the resource adapter

service.name: Admin Objects
service.description: Specifies the administration objects.

c:simple-property.name: class-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the fully qualified class name of a managed connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the resource adapter should be enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: use-java-context
c:simple-property.description: Setting this to false will bind the object into global JNDI. The default value is true.

service.name: Connection Definitions
service.description: Specifies the connection definitions.

operation.name: subsystem:flush-all-connection-in-pool
operation.description: Flushes all connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Flushes all connections in the pool

operation.name: subsystem:flush-idle-connection-in-pool
operation.description: Flushes all idle connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Flushes all idle connections in the pool

operation.name: subsystem:test-connection-in-pool
operation.description: Test if a connection can be obtained

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Test if a connection can be obtained

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry:expr
c:simple-property.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry-wait-millis:expr
c:simple-property.description: The allocation retry wait millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection

c:simple-property.name: background-validation
c:simple-property.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value requires a server restart. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: background-validation-millis:expr
c:simple-property.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value requires a server restart

c:simple-property.name: blocking-timeout-wait-millis:expr
c:simple-property.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time

c:simple-property.name: class-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the fully qualified class name of a managed connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the resource adapter should be enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: flush-strategy
c:simple-property.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-minutes:expr
c:simple-property.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is half of the smallest idle-timeout-minutes value of any pool. Changing this value requires a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: interleaving
c:simple-property.description: An element to enable interleaving for XA connections. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: max-pool-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The max-pool-size element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool. The default value is 20.

c:simple-property.name: min-pool-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The min-pool-size element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: no-recovery
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the connection pool should be excluded from recovery

c:simple-property.name: no-tx-separate-pool
c:simple-property.description: Oracle does not like XA connections getting used both inside and outside a JTA transaction. To workaround the problem you can create separate sub-pools for the different contexts. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: pad-xid
c:simple-property.description: Should the Xid be padded. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: pool-prefill
c:simple-property.description: Should the pool be prefilled. Changing this value requires a server restart. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: pool-use-strict-min
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the min-pool-size should be considered strictly. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: recovery-password
c:simple-property.description: The password used for recovery

c:simple-property.name: recovery-plugin-class-name
c:simple-property.description: The fully qualified class name of the recovery plugin implementation

c:map-property.name: recovery-plugin-properties
c:map-property.description: The properties for the recovery plugin

c:simple-property.name: recovery-security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The security domain used for recovery

c:simple-property.name: recovery-username
c:simple-property.description: The user name used for recovery

c:simple-property.name: same-rm-override
c:simple-property.description: The is-same-rm-override element allows one to unconditionally set whether the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource.isSameRM(XAResource) returns true or false

c:simple-property.name: security-application
c:simple-property.description: Indicates that app supplied parameters (such as from getConnection(user, pw)) are used to distinguish connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the security domain which defines the javax.security.auth.Subject that are used to distinguish connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: security-domain-and-application
c:simple-property.description: Indicates that either app supplied parameters (such as from getConnection(user, pw)) or Subject (from security domain) are used to distinguish connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: use-ccm
c:simple-property.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: use-fast-fail
c:simple-property.description: Whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false). The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: use-java-context
c:simple-property.description: Setting this to false will bind the object into global JNDI. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: use-try-lock:expr
c:simple-property.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds

c:simple-property.name: wrap-xa-resource
c:simple-property.description: Should the XAResource instances be wrapped in a org.jboss.tm.XAResourceWrapper instance. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: xa-resource-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The value is passed to XAResource.setTransactionTimeout(), in seconds. Default is zero

metric.description: The status of the cache manager component. May return null if the cache manager is not started.
The name of the cluster this node belongs to. May return null if the cache manager is not started.
The logical address of the cluster's coordinator. May return null if the cache manager is not started.
True if this node is the cluster's coordinator. May return null if the cache manager is not started.
The local address of the node. May return null if the cache manager is not started.

c:list-property.name: aliases
c:list-property.description: The list of aliases for this cache container

c:simple-property.name: default-cache
c:simple-property.description: The default infinispan cache

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: The jndi name to which to bind this cache container

c:simple-property.name: module
c:simple-property.description: The module whose class loader should be used when building this cache container's configuration. The default value is org.jboss.as.clustering.infinispan.

c:simple-property.name: statistics-enabled
c:simple-property.description: If enabled, statistics will be collected for this cache container.

metric.description: The number of cache node activations (bringing a node into memory from a cache store). May return null if the cache is not started.
Average time (in ms) for cache reads. Includes hits and misses. May return null if the cache is not started.
Average time (in ms) for cache writes. May return null if the cache is not started.
The status of the cache component. May return null if the cache is not started.
Time (in secs) since cache started. May return null if the cache is not started.
The hit/miss ratio for the cache (hits/hits+misses). May return null if the cache is not started.
The number of cache attribute hits. May return null if the cache is not started.
The number of cache invalidations. May return null if the cache is not started.
The number of cache attribute misses. May return null if the cache is not started.
The current number of entries in the cache. May return null if the cache is not started.
The number of cache node passivations (passivating a node from memory to a cache store). May return null if the cache is not started.
The read/write ratio of the cache ((hits+misses)/stores). May return null if the cache is not started.
The number of cache attribute remove hits. May return null if the cache is not started.
The number of cache attribute remove misses. May return null if the cache is not started.
The number of cache attribute put operations. May return null if the cache is not started.
Time (in secs) since cache statistics were reset. May return null if the cache is not started.

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: The jndi-name to which to bind this cache instance.

c:simple-property.name: mode
c:simple-property.description: Sets the clustered cache mode, ASYNC for asynchronous operation, or SYNC for synchronous operation.

c:simple-property.name: module
c:simple-property.description: The module whose class loader should be used when building this cache's configuration.

c:simple-property.name: queue-flush-interval
c:simple-property.description: In ASYNC mode, this attribute controls how often the asynchronous thread used to flush the replication queue runs. This should be a positive integer which represents thread wakeup time in milliseconds.

c:simple-property.name: queue-size
c:simple-property.description: In ASYNC mode, this attribute can be used to trigger flushing of the queue when it reaches a specific threshold.

c:simple-property.name: remote-timeout
c:simple-property.description: In SYNC mode, the timeout (in ms) used to wait for an acknowledgment when making a remote call, after which the call is aborted and an exception is thrown.

c:simple-property.name: __type
c:simple-property.description: Type of cache

service.name: Transport
service.description: The description of the transport used by this cache container

c:simple-property.name: channel
c:simple-property.description: The channel of this cache container's transport.

c:simple-property.name: lock-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The timeout for locks for the transport. The default value is 240000.

c:simple-property.name: default-stack
c:simple-property.description: Default stack to use

c:simple-property.name: worker-read-threads
c:simple-property.description: The number of read threads to create for the remoting worker. The default value is 1.

c:simple-property.name: worker-task-core-threads
c:simple-property.description: The number of core threads for the remoting worker task thread pool. The default value is 4.

c:simple-property.name: worker-task-keepalive
c:simple-property.description: The number of milliseconds to keep non-core remoting worker task threads alive. The default value is 60.

c:simple-property.name: worker-task-limit
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of remoting worker tasks to allow before rejecting. The default value is 16384.

c:simple-property.name: worker-task-max-threads
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of threads for the remoting worker task thread pool. The default value is 16.

c:simple-property.name: worker-write-threads
c:simple-property.description: The number of write threads to create for the remoting worker. The default value is 1.

operation.name: subsystem:close-connections-for-address
operation.description: Closes all the connections of clients connected to this server whose remote address contains the specified IP address.

c:simple-property.name: ip-address
c:simple-property.description: An IP address in string format.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: True if any connections were closed, false otherwise.

operation.name: subsystem:close-connections-for-user
operation.description: Closes all the connections of clients connected to this server under the specified user name.

c:simple-property.name: user
c:simple-property.description: An user name.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: True if any connections were closed, false otherwise.

operation.name: subsystem:close-consumer-connections-for-address
operation.description: Closes all the connections of consumers that are consuming from queues bound to the specified address.

c:simple-property.name: address-match
c:simple-property.description: An ActiveMQ address match.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: True if any connections were closed, false otherwise.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: A JSON string containing a list, each element of which is a set of properties describing a security role.

operation.name: subsystem:resolve-address-setting
operation.description: Resolve the address settings using ActiveMQ hierarchy of address settings.

c:simple-property.name: activemq-address
c:simple-property.description: The address to resolve.

operation.name: subsystem:rollback-prepared-transaction
operation.description: Heuristically rolls back a prepared transaction.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-as-base-64
c:simple-property.description: The Base64 representation of a transaction XID.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: True if the transaction was successfully rolled back, false otherwise.

metric.description: Whether the server is active (and accepting connections) or passive (in backup mode, waiting for failover).
Whether this server is started.
The server's version.

c:simple-property.name: async-connection-execution-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether incoming packets on the server should be handed off to a thread from the thread pool for processing. False if they should be handled on the remoting thread. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-password
c:simple-property.description: The password used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is CHANGE ME!!.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-user
c:simple-property.description: The user used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is ACTIVEMQ.CLUSTER.ADMIN.USER.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl-override:expr
c:simple-property.description: If set, this will override how long (in ms) to keep a connection alive without receiving a ping. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: create-bindings-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the bindings directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: create-journal-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the journal directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: id-cache-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size of the cache for pre-creating message IDs. The default value is 20000.

c:list-property.name: incoming-interceptors
c:list-property.description: The list of incoming interceptor classes used by this server.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-domain
c:simple-property.description: The JMX domain used to register internal ActiveMQ MBeans in the MBeanServer. The default value is org.apache.activemq.artemis.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-management-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether ActiveMQ should expose its internal management API via JMX. This is not recommended, as accessing these MBeans can lead to inconsistent configuration. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size of the internal buffer on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout (in nanoseconds) used to flush internal buffers on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-min-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: The minimal number of journal data files before we can start compacting. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-percentage:expr
c:simple-property.description: The percentage of live data on which we consider compacting the journal. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: journal-file-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The size (in bytes) of each journal file. The default value is 10485760.

c:simple-property.name: journal-max-io:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of write requests that can be in the AIO queue at any one time.

c:simple-property.name: journal-min-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: How many journal files to pre-create. The default value is 2.

c:simple-property.name: journal-pool-files:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of journal files that can be reused. ActiveMQ will create as many files as needed however when reclaiming files it will shrink back to the value (-1 means no limit). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-non-transactional
c:simple-property.description: Whether to wait for non transaction data to be synced to the journal before returning a response to the client. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-transactional
c:simple-property.description: Whether to wait for transaction data to be synchronized to the journal before returning a response to the client. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: journal-type
c:simple-property.description: The type of journal to use. The default value is ASYNCIO.

c:simple-property.name: log-journal-write-rate
c:simple-property.description: Whether to periodically log the journal's write rate and flush rate. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: management-address
c:simple-property.description: Address to send management messages to. The default value is jms.queue.activemq.management.

c:simple-property.name: management-notification-address
c:simple-property.description: The name of the address that consumers bind to to receive management notifications. The default value is activemq.notifications.

c:simple-property.name: memory-measure-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: Frequency to sample JVM memory in ms (or -1 to disable memory sampling). The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: memory-warning-threshold:expr
c:simple-property.description: Percentage of available memory which if exceeded results in a warning log. The default value is 25.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-max-day-history:expr
c:simple-property.description: How many days to keep message counter history. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-sample-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: The sample period (in ms) to use for message counters. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: message-expiry-scan-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often (in ms) to scan for expired messages. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: message-expiry-thread-priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: The priority of the thread expiring messages. The default value is 3.

c:list-property.name: outgoing-interceptors
c:list-property.description: The list of outgoing interceptor classes used by this server.

c:simple-property.name: override-in-vm-security
c:simple-property.description: Whether the ActiveMQ server will override security credentials for in-vm connections. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: page-max-concurrent-io:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of concurrent reads allowed on paging. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: perf-blast-pages:expr
c:simple-property.description: TODO. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: persist-delivery-count-before-delivery
c:simple-property.description: Whether the delivery count is persisted before delivery. False means that this only happens after a message has been cancelled. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: persist-id-cache
c:simple-property.description: Whether IDs are persisted to the journal. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: persistence-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server will use the file based journal for persistence. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: run-sync-speed-test
c:simple-property.description: Whether on startup to perform a diagnostic test on how fast your disk can sync. Useful when determining performance issues. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: scheduled-thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of threads that the main scheduled thread pool has. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The security domain to use to verify user and role information. The default value is other.

c:simple-property.name: security-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether security is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: security-invalidation-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: How long (in ms) to wait before invalidating the security cache. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: server-dump-interval:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often to dump basic runtime information to the server log. A value less than 1 disables this feature. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: statistics-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether gathering of statistics such as message counters are enabled. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The number of threads that the main thread pool has. -1 means no limit. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: How long (in ms) before a transaction can be removed from the resource manager after create time. The default value is 300000.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-timeout-scan-period:expr
c:simple-property.description: How often (in ms) to scan for timeout transactions. The default value is 1000.

c:simple-property.name: wild-card-routing-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server supports wild card routing. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.description: The retry interval. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.description: The retry interval multiplier. The default value is 1.0.

c:simple-property.name: scheduled-thread-pool-max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The scheduled thread pool max size. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.description: The thread pool max size. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-batch-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The transaction batch size. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: use-global-pools
c:simple-property.description: True to use global pools. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: consume
c:simple-property.description: his permission allows the user to consume a message from a queue bound to matching addresses. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: create-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to create a durable queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: create-non-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to create a temporary queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: delete-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to delete a durable queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: delete-non-durable-queue
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to delete a temporary queue. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: manage
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to invoke management operations by sending management messages to the management address. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: send
c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to send a message to matching addresses. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: address-full-policy
c:simple-property.description: Determines what happens when an address where max-size-bytes is specified becomes full. (PAGE, DROP or BLOCK). The default value is PAGE.

c:simple-property.name: dead-letter-address
c:simple-property.description: The dead letter address

c:simple-property.name: expiry-address
c:simple-property.description: Defines where to send a message that has expired.

c:simple-property.name: last-value-queue
c:simple-property.description: Defines whether a queue only uses last values or not. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-delivery-attempts
c:simple-property.description: Defines how many time a cancelled message can be redelivered before sending to the dead-letter-address. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: max-size-bytes
c:simple-property.description: The max bytes size. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: message-counter-history-day-limit
c:simple-property.description: Day limit for the message counter history. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: page-max-cache-size
c:simple-property.description: The number of page files to keep in memory to optimize IO during paging navigation. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: page-size-bytes
c:simple-property.description: The paging size. The default value is 10485760.

c:simple-property.name: redelivery-delay
c:simple-property.description: Defines how long to wait before attempting redelivery of a cancelled message. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: redistribution-delay
c:simple-property.description: Defines how long to wait when the last consumer is closed on a queue before redistributing any messages. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: send-to-dla-on-no-route
c:simple-property.description: If this parameter is set to true for that address, if the message is not routed to any queues it will instead be sent to the dead letter address (DLA) for that address, if it exists. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: grouping-handler-address
c:simple-property.description: A reference to a cluster connection and the address it uses.

c:simple-property.name: timeout
c:simple-property.description: How long to wait for a handling decision to be made; an exception will be thrown during the send if this timeout is reached, ensuring that strict ordering is kept. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Whether the handler is the single 'Local' handler for the cluster, which makes handling decisions, or a 'Remote' handler which converses with the local handler.

metric.description: The node ID used by this cluster connection.
Whether the cluster connection is started.

c:simple-property.name: call-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The timeout (in ms) for remote calls made by the cluster connection. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: check-period
c:simple-property.description: The period (in milliseconds) between client failure check. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-connection-address
c:simple-property.description: Each cluster connection only applies to messages sent to an address that starts with this value.

c:simple-property.name: confirmation-window-size
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation-window-size to use for the connection used to forward messages to a target node. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl
c:simple-property.description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) for which the connections used by the cluster connections are considered alive (in the absence of heartbeat). The default value is 60000.

c:simple-property.name: connector-ref
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation-window-size to use for the connection used to forward messages to a target node.

c:simple-property.name: discovery-group-name
c:simple-property.description: The discovery group used to obtain the list of other servers in the cluster to which this cluster connection will make connections. Must be undefined (null) if 'static-connectors' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: forward-when-no-consumers
c:simple-property.description: Whether messages will be distributed round robin between other nodes of the cluster irrespective of whether there are matching or indeed any consumers on other nodes. If this is set to false (the default) then ActiveMQ Artemis will only forward messages to other nodes of the cluster if the address to which they are being forwarded has queues which have consumers, and if those consumers have message filters (selectors) at least one of those selectors must match the message. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-hops
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of times a message can be forwarded. ActiveMQ Artemis can be configured to also load balance messages to nodes which might be connected to it only indirectly with other ActiveMQ Artemis servers as intermediates in a chain. The default value is 1.

c:simple-property.name: max-retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The maximum interval of time used to retry connections. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: min-large-message-size
c:simple-property.description: The minimum size (in bytes) for a message before it is considered as a large message. The default value is 102400.

c:simple-property.name: reconnect-attempts
c:simple-property.description: The total number of reconnect attempts the bridge will make before giving up and shutting down. A value of -1 signifies an unlimited number of attempts. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The period in milliseconds between subsequent reconnection attempts, if the connection to the target server has failed. The default value is 500.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval-multiplier
c:simple-property.description: A multiplier to apply to the time since the last retry to compute the time to the next retry. This allows you to implement an exponential backoff between retry attempts. The default value is 1.0.

c:list-property.name: static-connectors:nullable
c:list-property.description: The statically defined list of connectors to which this cluster connection will make connections. Must be undefined (null) if 'discovery-group-name' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: use-duplicate-detection
c:simple-property.description: Whether the bridge will automatically insert a duplicate id property into each message that it forwards. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: broadcast-period
c:simple-property.description: The period in milliseconds between consecutive broadcasts. The default value is 2000.

c:list-property.name: connectors
c:list-property.description: Specifies the names of connectors that will be broadcast.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The broadcast group socket binding.

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description:
The actual filesystem path. Treated as an absolute path, unless the 'relative-to' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.

If treated as an absolute path, the actual runtime pathname specified by the value of this attribute will be determined as follows:

If this value is already absolute, then the value is directly used. Otherwise the runtime pathname is resolved in a system-dependent way. On UNIX systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current user directory. On Microsoft Windows systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current directory of the drive named by the pathname, if any; if not, it is resolved against the current user directory.

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description:
The name of another previously named path, or of one of the standard paths provided by the system. If 'relative-to' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute. The standard paths provided by the system include:
  • jboss.home - the root directory of the JBoss AS distribution
  • user.home - user's home directory
  • user.dir - user's current working directory
  • java.home - java installation directory
  • jboss.server.base.dir - root directory for an individual server instance
  • jboss.server.data.dir - directory the server will use for persistent data file storage
  • jboss.server.log.dir - directory the server will use for log file storage
  • jboss.server.tmp.dir - directory the server will use for temporary file storage
  • jboss.domain.servers.dir - directory under which a host controller will create the working area for individual server instances

c:simple-property.name: __name
c:simple-property.description: Path Type

c:template.name: Journal Directory
c:template.description: The directory in which the message journal lives. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/journal.

c:template.name: Paging Directory
c:template.description: The directory where page files are stored. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/paging.

c:template.name: Large Messages Directory
c:template.description: The directory in which large messages are stored. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/largemessages.

c:template.name: Bindings Directory
c:template.description: The directory in which the bindings journal lives. The default is ${jboss.server.data.dir}/messaging/bindings.

metric.description: Whether the bridge is started.

c:simple-property.name: check-period
c:simple-property.description: The period (in milliseconds) between client failure check. The default value is 30000.

c:simple-property.name: confirmation-window-size
c:simple-property.description: The confirmation-window-size to use for the connection used to forward messages to the target node. The default value is 1048576.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl
c:simple-property.description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) for which the connections used by the bridges are considered alive (in the absence of heartbeat). The default value is 60000.

c:simple-property.name: discovery-group-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the discovery group used by this bridge. Must be undefined (null) if 'static-connectors' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: failover-on-server-shutdown
c:simple-property.description: Whether the bridge will attempt to failover onto a backup server (if specified) when the target server is cleanly shutdown rather than crashed.

c:simple-property.name: filter
c:simple-property.description: An optional filter string. If specified then only messages which match the filter expression specified will be forwarded. The filter string follows the ActiveMQ Artemis filter expression syntax described in the ActiveMQ Artemis documentation.

c:simple-property.name: forwarding-address
c:simple-property.description: The address on the target server that the message will be forwarded to. If a forwarding address is not specified then the original destination of the message will be retained.

c:simple-property.name: ha
c:simple-property.description: Whether or not this bridge should support high availability. True means it will connect to any available server in a cluster and support failover. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The maximum interval of time used to retry connections. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: min-large-message-size
c:simple-property.description: The minimum size (in bytes) for a message before it is considered as a large message. The default value is 102400.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: The password to use when creating the bridge connection to the remote server. If it is not specified the default cluster password specified by the cluster-password attribute in the root messaging subsystem resource will be used. The default value is CHANGE ME!!.

c:simple-property.name: queue-name
c:simple-property.description: The unique name of the local queue that the bridge consumes from.

c:simple-property.name: reconnect-attempts
c:simple-property.description: The total number of reconnect attempts the bridge will make before giving up and shutting down. A value of -1 signifies an unlimited number of attempts. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval
c:simple-property.description: The period in milliseconds between subsequent reconnection attempts, if the connection to the target server has failed. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: retry-interval-multiplier
c:simple-property.description: A multiplier to apply to the time since the last retry to compute the time to the next retry. This allows you to implement an exponential backoff between retry attempts. The default value is 1.0.

c:list-property.name: static-connectors:nullable
c:list-property.description: A list of names of statically defined connectors used by this bridge. Must be undefined (null) if 'discovery-group-name' is defined.

c:simple-property.name: transformer-class-name
c:simple-property.description: The name of a user-defined class which implements the org.apache.activemq.artemis.core.server.cluster.Transformer interface.

c:simple-property.name: use-duplicate-detection
c:simple-property.description: Whether the bridge will automatically insert a duplicate id property into each message that it forwards. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: user
c:simple-property.description: The user name to use when creating the bridge connection to the remote server. If it is not specified the default cluster user specified by the cluster-user attribute in the root messaging subsystem resource will be used. The default value is ACTIVEMQ.CLUSTER.ADMIN.USER.

c:simple-property.name: initial-wait-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Period, in ms, to wait for an initial broadcast to give us at least one node in the cluster. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: refresh-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Period the discovery group waits after receiving the last broadcast from a particular server before removing that server's connector pair entry from its list. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The discovery group socket binding.

c:simple-property.name: factory-class
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the factory class that can instantiate the connector service.

plugin.help:
Versioned Deployments (Since RHQ 4.12)

This plugin supports Versioned Deployments. A Deployment (EAR, WAR, etc) can be a managed server deployment or standalone deployment. This includes Versioned Subdeployments (WAR, EJB JAR inside an EAR, etc). A Versioned Deployment is one that incorporates a version into the artifact name. For example, testapp-1.0.war. By default the plugin will strip the version from the artifact and create a resource named "testapp.war" with version "1.0". The benefit to this approach is that when upgrading to testapp-2.0.war, for example, the logical "testapp.war" resource remains in inventory and is reset to version "2.0". In this way all historical data is maintained, and the resource does not fall into a permanent "DOWN" state. Without versioned deployments, after the upgrade there would exist in inventory two resources: a permanently DOWN testapp-1.0.war resource as well as a new testapp-2.0.war resource.

The version matching is designed to match "Maven-style" versions (see http://mojo.codehaus.org/versions-maven-plugin/version-rules.html). The version stamp is delimited by a dash, and must minimally include a Major.Minor version. This avoids confusion with distinct but poorly named Deployments like app-1.war and app-2.war, or app1.war and app2.war. In both of those cases the version matcher would not match and all of the apps would be different resources.

The default pattern is the following regular expression:

^(.*?)-([0-9]+\\.[0-9].*)(\\..*)$

There is a system property that can be set to alter the default behavior of the plugin. Note that for the property to have any effect it must be applied to every applicable RHQ Agent prior to its startup. To disable versioned Deployments and allow for version stamps to remain in the Deployment names set: 

rhq.as7.VersionedSubsystemDiscovery.pattern=disable
To override the default pattern (not recommended) set: 
rhq.as7.VersionedSubsystemDiscovery.pattern=YourPatternHere
Note that the custom regex pattern *must* capture three groups as does the default. Group1=name, Group2=version, Group3=extension. The single pattern is applied to all Deployments.

Upgrade Behavior

Earlier versions of RHQ may have Deployment resources in inventory that contain version stamps in their names. This plugin implements the ResourceUpgradeFacet, which will convert the existing resources on the first Agent startup with the new updated plugin. To avoid this the above system property must be set in advance. Behavior can always be changed. If necessary update the system property as needed and, when desired, uninventory any old resources that are no longer needed after the change.
Multiple Versions of the Same Resource in Inventory
The new feature is designed for the use case where a single version of a given resource is in inventory under a given parent. When upgraded the logical resource is maintained and its version is updated. For installations where multiple versions already exist the resource upgrade may generate failures. For example, if under some server I have both app-1.0.war and app-2.0.war deployed, both will try to upgrade to the same logical resource: app.war. To avoid issues it is recommended to either, 1) disable this feature prior to upgrade or 2) uninventory resources leaving only a single version of the resource.

MISSING Resource Support (Since RHQ 4.12)

This plugin supports the MISSING Resource Policy feature introduced in RHQ 4.12. Deployments and Domain Deployments can be configured to be automatically uninventoried or ignored if they can no longer be found in the underlying appication server.
Interaction with Versioned Deployment Support
If utilizing versioned deployments as described above, it is recommended to leave the MISSING Policy as DOWN (the default). Otherwise, while updating versions it is possible during the update window to have the resource removed or ignored.

Bundle Handover Support (Since RHQ 4.12)

The Standalone Server and Host Controller resource types from this plugin support the Bundle Content Handover feature introduced in RHQ 4.12. The following sections show example recipes for bundle deployments with resources of these types as bundle targets. They also define the list of actions and parameters the resource component understands.

Standalone Server
This resource type supports the following actions:

action = deployment: deploys the content to the server
Optional parameters:
  • runtimeName: Runtime name of the uploaded file (e.g. 'my.war'); if not present, the file name is used

action = execute-script: executes a server CLI script
Optional parameters:
  • waitTime (in seconds): how long to wait for completion; defaults to an hour
  • killOnTimeout (true/false): should the CLI process be killed if timeout is reached; defaults to false

Sample ANT bundle recipe

    <?xml version="1.0"?>

    <project name="handover-bundle" default="main" xmlns:rhq="antlib:org.rhq.bundle">

      <rhq:bundle name="example.com (EAP 6)" version="1.1"
                  description="example.com corporate website hosted on EAP 6">

        <rhq:input-property
            name="myapp.runtime.name"
            defaultValue="website.war"
            required="true"/>

        <rhq:deployment-unit name="example.com deployment unit" compliance="filesAndDirectories">
          <rhq:file name="prepareDatasource.cli">
            <rhq:handover action="execute-script" failonerror="false"/>
          </rhq:file>
          <rhq:archive name="website.war">
            <rhq:handover action="deployment">
              <rhq:handover-param name="runtimeName" value="${myapp.runtime.name}"/>
            </rhq:handover>
          </rhq:archive>
        </rhq:deployment-unit>

      </rhq:bundle>

      <target name="main"/>

    </project>
Host Controller
This component supports the following actions:

action = deployment: deploys the content to a server group
Required parameters:
  • serverGroup: The name of the server group this deployment should be deployed to; this is the EAP domain server group, do not confuse it with RHQ's bundle destination resource group
Optional parameters:
  • runtimeName: Runtime name of the uploaded file (e.g. 'my.war'); if not present, the file name is used

action = execute-script: executes a server CLI script
Optional parameters:
  • waitTime (in seconds): how long to wait for completion; defaults to an hour
  • killOnTimeout (true/false): should the CLI process be killed if timeout is reached; defaults to false

Sample ANT bundle recipe

    <?xml version="1.0"?>

    <project name="handover-bundle" default="main" xmlns:rhq="antlib:org.rhq.bundle">

      <rhq:bundle name="example.com (EAP 6)" version="1.1"
                  description="example.com corporate website hosted on EAP 6">

        <rhq:input-property
            name="myapp.runtime.name"
            defaultValue="website.war"
            required="true"/>
        <rhq:input-property
            name="server.group"
            defaultValue="main-server-group-01"
            required="true"/>

        <rhq:deployment-unit name="example.com deployment unit" compliance="filesAndDirectories">
          <rhq:file name="prepareDatasource.cli">
            <rhq:handover action="execute-script" failonerror="false"/>
          </rhq:file>
          <rhq:archive name="website.war">
            <rhq:handover action="deployment">
              <rhq:handover-param name="runtimeName" value="${myapp.runtime.name}"/>
              <rhq:handover-param name="serverGroup" value="${server.group}"/>
            </rhq:handover>
          </rhq:archive>
        </rhq:deployment-unit>

      </rhq:bundle>

      <target name="main"/>

    </project>
